[{'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-12-17 21:03:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If you're wondering why the heck anyone would do such a crazy thing, the answer is: they wouldn't. Yet.

I'm working on making the replica counts gradually adjustable (see https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/change-replicas), and when you've got non-integer replica counts, then you'll get mismatched replica counts as part of normal operation."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-17 21:23:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Having some time to think about it a bit, I want to change my review, as I'm a bit worried about the code that puts together the updates.  The assumption is that the number of hosts and devices should be equal.  If not, it currently just concatenates the update list.  I would prefer that it instead returns an error, and logs the error accordingly. revisions:
[{'created': '2012-12-17 21:01:19.000000000', 'message': "Allow for multiple X-(Account|Container)-* headers.

When the number of account/container or container/object replicas are
different, Swift had a few misbehaviors. This commit fixes them.

* On an object PUT/POST/DELETE, if there were 3 object replicas and
  only 2 container replicas, then only 2 requests would be made to
  object servers. Now, 3 requests will be made, but the third won't
  have any X-Container-* headers in it.

* On an object PUT/POST/DELETE, if there were 3 object replicas and 4
  container replicas, then only 3/4 container servers would receive
  immediate updates; the fourth would be ignored. Now one of the
  object servers will receive multiple (comma-separated) values in the
  X-Container-* headers and it will attempt to contact both of them.

  One side effect is that multiple async_pendings may be written for
  updates to the same object. They'll have differing timestamps,
  though, so all but the newest will be deleted unread. To trigger
  this behavior, you have to have more container replicas than object
  replicas, 2 or more of the container servers must be down, and the
  headers sent to one object server must reference 2 or more down
  container servers; it's unlikely enough and the consequences are so
  minor that it didn't seem worth fixing.

The situation with account/containers is analogous, only without the
async_pendings.

Change-Id: I98bc2de93fb6b2346d6de1d764213d7563653e8d
"}, {'created': '2012-12-21 19:52:42.000000000', 'message': "Allow for multiple X-(Account|Container)-* headers.

  replicas, 2 or more of the container servers must be down, and the
  headers sent to one object server must reference 2 or more down
  container servers; it's unlikely enough and the consequences are so
  minor that it didn't seem worth fixing.

The situation with account/containers is analogous, only without the
async_pendings.

Change-Id: I98bc2de93fb6b2346d6de1d764213d7563653e8d

commit_message:
Allow for multiple X-(Account|Container)-* headers.

When the number of account/container or container/object replicas are
different, Swift had a few misbehaviors. This commit fixes them.

* On an object PUT/POST/DELETE, if there were 3 object replicas and
  only 2 container replicas, then only 2 requests would be made to
  object servers. Now, 3 requests will be made, but the third won't
  have any X-Container-* headers in it.

* On an object PUT/POST/DELETE, if there were 3 object replicas and 4
  container replicas, then only 3/4 container servers would receive
  immediate updates; the fourth would be ignored. Now one of the
  object servers will receive multiple (comma-separated) values in the
  X-Container-* headers and it will attempt to contact both of them.

  One side effect is that multiple async_pendings may be written for
  updates to the same object. They'll have differing timestamps,
  though, so all but the newest will be deleted unread. To trigger
  this behavior, you have to have more container replicas than object
  replicas, 2 or more of the container servers must be down, and the
  headers sent to one object server must reference 2 or more down
  container servers; it's unlikely enough and the consequences are so
  minor that it didn't seem worth fixing.

The situation with account/containers is analogous, only without the
async_pendings.

Change-Id: I98bc2de93fb6b2346d6de1d764213d7563653e8d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-21 22:39:07.000000000', 'message': "Improve error message for missing NFS share config

If FLAGS.nfs_share_config is not defined, the error will reference
the name of the config option to set.

If the nfs_share_config path doesn't exist, the error will reference
the path that was configured.

This will hopefully simplify troubleshooting of NFS configuration.

Change-Id: Ica6a60a63330554dc880f36962f3a081926ce5cf
"}]
commit_message:
Improve error message for missing NFS share config

If FLAGS.nfs_share_config is not defined, the error will reference
the name of the config option to set.

If the nfs_share_config path doesn't exist, the error will reference
the path that was configured.

This will hopefully simplify troubleshooting of NFS configuration.

Change-Id: Ica6a60a63330554dc880f36962f3a081926ce5cf

Fixes: bug #1103665

commit_message:
Remove duplicate GRUB configuration

    The diskimage-builder now contains the GRUB configuration

    Removing extra (unnecessary) packages from base-apps

    Locking-in version on libmysql18 so that it works with mysql and percona

Change-Id: I81beafe0b9d6b563f07611ffcf01eefc8a28fb4c
Fixes: bug #1103665

commit_message:
Reduce number of iptable-save restore loops

Instead of running iptables-save and iptables-restore per table,
run iptables save and restore on all tables at once.

Change-Id: If610d07c22ddaeb03ab37ee64d3d3a55d5e5b34f

commit_message:
Parametrized paths for components in test config

Parametrized paths for keystone, glance, nova, reddwarf components
and set the appropriately in the test config. This is needed for the
vm-gate integration piece. The vm-gate doesn't use /opt/stack as the
location of the OpenStack components, so these need to be parametrized
and set correctly.

Fixes bug 1103718

Change-Id: I54bcf15af1423e22b2efef722eb19c222fce766e

commit_message:
Added doc support for Agents API

Agents API extension was not documented in API Doc page
Modified:   src/docbkx/api-ref.xml > Added section to show Agents ref in api-site
New wadl:   src/wadls/compute-api/src/ext/os-agents.wadl > linking to samples in api_samples
Also modified existing json and xml samples for a clearer usage.
Fixes:  bug 1078010

Change-Id: I75db8ccc64c519c1c76d10cc59e20fc6c5fb8058

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-15 19:39:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add handler for CORS "actual requests"

Fix for 1095130

* Added a wrapper function around public methods to handle
  CORS actual requests. These requests need to return some
  extra headers to be valid responses to a CORS request.
  Access-Control-Expose-Headers and Access-Control-Allow-Origin.

* Some refactoring of the OPTIONS method to so the
  "is_origin_allowed" logic can ube reused.

* Added a little extra details to the CORS documentation.

Change-Id: I68538e472a900775427f21a8a59e738a83dcc8bc
'}, {'created': '2013-01-15 19:41:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add handler for CORS "actual requests"

Fix for bug 1095130

* Added a wrapper function around public methods to handle
  CORS actual requests. These requests need to return some
  extra headers to be valid responses to a CORS request.
  Access-Control-Expose-Headers and Access-Control-Allow-Origin.

* Some refactoring of the OPTIONS method to so the
  "is_origin_allowed" logic can ube reused.

* Added a little extra details to the CORS documentation.

Change-Id: I68538e472a900775427f21a8a59e738a83dcc8bc

commit_message:
Add handler for CORS "actual requests"

Fix for bug 1095130

* Added a wrapper function around public methods to handle
  CORS actual requests. These requests need to return some
  extra headers to be valid responses to a CORS request.
  Access-Control-Expose-Headers and Access-Control-Allow-Origin.

* Added support for the CORS header Access-Control-Expose-Headers.

* Some refactoring of the OPTIONS method so the
  "is_origin_allowed" logic can be reused.

* Added a little extra detail to the CORS documentation.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I68538e472a900775427f21a8a59e738a83dcc8bc

commit_message:
UTC ISO8601 from timestamp

Taken from glance xattr.py module. This function converts timestamp
formated dates into a UTC Iso 8601 date. It is being required in
multiple places now (mostly on clients printing dates) in order to make
dates human readable.

Change-Id: I6f19325a4c2df241a0ef76bd256280a2930d9265

commit_message:
Add support for running xml tests in tempest.

This adds a env_variable to enable using xml in tempest
instead of json.

Change-Id: Idfc95b78cf2fcabb8c8270803375a20d055e7d2b

commit_message:
Add UTC offset information to the timezone

In the User Settings, indicate besides the timezone name what the
actual timezone/UTC offset is.

Fixes bug 1103003

Change-Id: I8070df2bc0380da1555c40dc9394895fbfde6848

commit_message:
Split the logo.png into two files to enable splash page branding

This copies logo.png into logo-splash.png and updates the stylesheet
so that the splash screen references the latter.  This facilitates
changing the branding on the splash page only.

Fixes Bug 1102769

Change-Id: Ifd6d213794489dd2664a7124a2d663e390d82331

commit_message:
Don't pass the entire list of instances to compute

We don't need to pass the entire (potentially large) list of instances
down to the compute node. This will save potentially thousands of
bytes in the message.

Fixes bug 1103669

Change-Id: Ia90a19dffa90575a0f02191603ae9e96ca9258df

commit_message:
Set MySQL slow log to record every query

Since devstack is for development, lets record all SQL queries to enable
debugging, and further development.

Change-Id: Idb4078a0d3a84151ad4c506f8861637d84ae47ad

"}, {'created': '2013-01-15 13:55:24.000000000', 'message': "Allow for self-signed SSL certificates

* Backwards compatible with older configuration files that
  use host/port/use_ssl/path/api_version. Those options are
  now marked as DEPRECATED
* Also simplifies the auth URI configuration to just a URI
  and a boolean flag for disabling SSL cert validation
* Will require a corresponding change to devstack's configure_tempest.sh
  script as well as SmokeStack's tempest configuration generation...
* Corrects the volume admin base test classes to match the correct
  pattern used in the base compute test classes for admin actions
* Corrects the quotas client stuff. There is no reason to have a separate
  admin quotas client. Just a single client, passed admin credentials, is
  all that is needed for an admin client...

Change-Id: I7a78e2c8e3c1d06e8e49b817d5c5483ace730d46

commit_message:
Allow for self-signed SSL certificates

* Backwards compatible with older configuration files that
  use host/port/use_ssl/path/api_version. Those options are
  now marked as DEPRECATED
* Also simplifies the auth URI configuration to just a URI
  and a boolean flag for disabling SSL cert validation
* Will require a corresponding change to devstack's configure_tempest.sh
  script as well as SmokeStack's tempest configuration generation...
* Corrects the volume admin base test classes to match the correct
  pattern used in the base compute test classes for admin actions
* Corrects the quotas client stuff. There is no reason to have a separate
  admin quotas client. Just a single client, passed admin credentials, is
  all that is needed for an admin client...

Change-Id: I7a78e2c8e3c1d06e8e49b817d5c5483ace730d46

commit_message:
Bump the base rpc version of the network api to 1.7.

Change I2627e8b0f45c5c39bbbf1a4a12b448e1992fa4b4
bumped the RPC version of the API to 1.7
but did not bump the RPC version in the network
manager.

Change-Id: I1c719a1458ef5892e90aabee92a8b5e93cfa11c8

commit_message:
LinuxBridge: set port status as 'DOWN' on creation

When a port is created the initial status will be 'DOWN'. The agent
in turn will update the plugin of the actual port status.

Change-Id: I66b51501304f7cb3f0157a4adaec4b82c62b30a3

commit_message:
Add REST api to manage bare-metal nodes

* create/delete/list/show bare-metal nodes
* add/remove interfaces to/from bare-metal nodes

blueprint general-bare-metal-provisioning-framework

Change-Id: I1e76f7e3f7f74087e844cfb23dc92154f4c3e127

commit_message:
Remove duplicated tapdev creation code from libvirt VIF

Move the 'create_tap_dev' method out of the linux_net class
QuantumLinuxBridgeInterfaceDriver, to be a standalone method.
Make the libvirt LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver call this method
instead of duplicating the tapdev creation code

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: Ib9b5fb3aed5e339464c4f367179911166f2cddfb
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-07 18:45:13.000000000', 'message': 'Move helper APIs for OVS ports into linux_net

The libvirt vif driver impls have some helper APIs for creating
and deleteing OVS bridge ports. These are not specific to libvirt,
so move them into the linux_net class which holds other general
Linux networking helper APIs.

With this change LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver no longer needs
to inherit from LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver.

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver

commit_message:
Move helper APIs for OVS ports into linux_net

The libvirt vif driver impls have some helper APIs for creating
and deleteing OVS bridge ports. These are not specific to libvirt,
so move them into the linux_net class which holds other general
Linux networking helper APIs.

With this change LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver no longer needs
to inherit from LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver.

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: I520c23f9dc9d64f834dec875fb49d17b43abd527
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

subject: Add 'ovs_interfaceid' to nova network VIF model

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-13 16:40:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

I don't understand the reason we need to introduce a new parameter 'ovs_interfaceid'. When Quantum is used, Quantum port id is used as VIF uuid (in quantumv2/api) and OVS external_id:iface-id is used to store the port id (= VIF uuid). Since ovs_interfaceid provides no additional information, IMO we don't need to add a new parameter.

If ovs_interfaceid is introduced, ovs_interfaceid needs to be set in quantumv2/api.py. Now no one set this parameter."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-01-14 09:37:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> I don't understand the reason we need to introduce a new parameter 'ovs_interfaceid'.
> When Quantum is used, Quantum port id is used as VIF uuid (in quantumv2/api) and OVS
> external_id:iface-id is used to store the port id (= VIF uuid). Since ovs_interfaceid
> provides no additional information, IMO we don't need to add a new parameter.

The fact that Quantum uses the VIF uuid to form the ovs_interfaceid is a Quamtum
specific implementation detail. The intent behind this change is to ensure that the
hypervisor VIF drivers are not tied to the impl specifics. Thus the VIF model should
contain an explicit ovs_interfaceid, and the network driver should populate that
based on its desired policy, rather than the hypervisor VIF driver know about
Quantum's needs for naming.


> If ovs_interfaceid is introduced, ovs_interfaceid needs to be set in quantumv2/api.py. Now no one set this parameter.

Yes, it should have been set there. That was a mistake in this patch."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-01-14 13:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-14 14:37:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

commit_message:
Add 'ovs_interfaceid' to nova network VIF model

Instead of relying on the hypervisor VIF drivers to make up
the correct 'interfaceid' parameter based on the VIF uuid,
explicitly tell them what the ovs interfaceid value should
be.

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: I77bb1bcb8f38c8c6e20e9ccbbbd490b251f32fef
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-23 03:07:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add more command-line options to swift-bench.

These settings:
  1. are already exposed via config file
  2. were not exposed as command-line options, and
  3. are things I wanted on the command line while benchmarking recently.

I didn't include short options for --(get|put|delete)-concurrency
since I couldn't think of good single-letter ones, and optparse won't
take "-gc", "-pc", or "-dc".

Change-Id: I0bd7c7ae2892244eed37b8c10c9357dc7e1190d3
'}]
commit_message:
Add more command-line options to swift-bench.

These settings:
  1. are already exposed via config file
  2. were not exposed as command-line options, and
  3. are things I wanted on the command line while benchmarking recently.

I didn't include short options for --(get|put|delete)-concurrency
since I couldn't think of good single-letter ones, and optparse won't
take "-gc", "-pc", or "-dc".

Change-Id: I0bd7c7ae2892244eed37b8c10c9357dc7e1190d3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-21 12:17:33.000000000', 'message': "ensure zeros are written out when clearing volumes

Note O_DIRECT is _not_ used when copying from /dev/zero
and there are issues with enabling that (see 444cd542).
Therefore we arrange to have dd issue an fdatasync()
to ensure the data is persisted, lest it be discarded
from the write cache when the device is unprovisioned.

* cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py (_copy_volume): Add 'conv=fdatasync'
to the dd option list if O_DIRECT isn't used when clearing
(which it won't as descrived above).

Fixes bug: 1100363
Change-Id: I76789557754ebaeb6d52bb34548a2ef17808fbf6
"}]
commit_message:
ensure zeros are written out when clearing volumes

Note O_DIRECT is _not_ used when copying from /dev/zero
and there are issues with enabling that (see 444cd542).
Therefore we arrange to have dd issue an fdatasync()
to ensure the data is persisted, lest it be discarded
from the write cache when the device is unprovisioned.

* cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py (_copy_volume): Add 'conv=fdatasync'
to the dd option list if O_DIRECT isn't used when clearing
(which it won't as descrived above).

Fixes bug: 1100363
Change-Id: I76789557754ebaeb6d52bb34548a2ef17808fbf6

This is somewhat confusing, the first conditional checks if the path exists, but the 2nd does as well.. If the folder is there but the file is not, we assume different things? Seems like we could just validate the path/file exists or not and only have 1 skip'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-01-18 18:00:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, looks confusing... here's the idea though:
1. The first check is to see if the path exists (do we have INET6 support and are we on a platform that we know how to queire it's status)

2. The second check assumes we made it through the first check obviously, and checks to make sure that not only does the system support IPV6, but that it also has an IPV6 configured interface available.

So the second check isn't a path check, but an actual configuration check that depends on the path.  If that makes sense."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-01-18 18:11:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

[{'created': '2013-01-18 17:11:19.000000000', 'message': "Clean up IPV6 config checks in test_wsgi.

Two tests in test_wsgi require a configured IPV6 interface.
We added a check/skip for this but it wasn't very graceful and
didn't work on OS-X or platforms other than Linux.

This patch implements the checks a bit cleaner using the skip_if
decorator, and only performs the config check on Linux systems.

Change-Id: I950fdfeb8135912faf5dcaabe52fb87abd73dd1e
"}, {'created': '2013-01-18 18:20:34.000000000', 'message': "Clean up IPV6 config checks in test_wsgi.

Change-Id: I950fdfeb8135912faf5dcaabe52fb87abd73dd1e
"}, {'created': '2013-01-20 02:52:21.000000000', 'message': "Clean up IPV6 config checks in test_wsgi.

We added a check/skip for this but it wasn't very graceful and
didn't work on OS-X or platforms other than Linux.

This patch implements the checks a bit cleaner using the skip_if

Change-Id: I950fdfeb8135912faf5dcaabe52fb87abd73dd1e

commit_message:
Clean up IPV6 config checks in test_wsgi.

Two tests in test_wsgi require a configured IPV6 interface.
We added a check/skip for this but it wasn't very graceful and
didn't work on OS-X or platforms other than Linux.

This patch implements the checks a bit cleaner using the skip_if
decorator, and combines the linux/path check and configured interface
check.

Change-Id: I950fdfeb8135912faf5dcaabe52fb87abd73dd1e

'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-01-23 18:37:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

There are two way to update status, i.e plugin updates it directly or via rpc from agent. So there seems a race condition.
I haven't looked closely the code, though.
What's the convention?

Eventually periodic loop in agent would fixes up those inconsistencies, I'm not sure it's designed or not.
At least it's not trivial and worth comments."}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-01-23 18:37:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Gary thanks for the ocmment. So how about the following?
- suppose the first state.
  admin_state: down, status: down
- user updates admin_state to up, then the plugin sends notificaiton.
  But update_device_up rpc from agent to plugin delays for some reason
- user updates admin_state to down immediately, and the plugin sets status to DOWN directly and send notification.
- the plugin processes update_device_up and sets status to UP.

This is in theory. I'm not seeing the issue in practice."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-23 18:37:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Hi Isaku,
You have a good point. I guess that it will be healthier that the agent do all of the status updates. I'll post a patch for this. I guess the penalty of an additional message will be ok (this is just when there is a admin_state_up change).
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-23 18:37:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Hi,
Regarding Isaku's comment: there are two updates to the status.
i. The agent has an indication that the port is up/down and it notify's the plugin
ii. the user sets the admin state as donw. in this case we save a round trip of a message from the agent and the status is updated by the plugin.
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-23 18:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-23 18:37:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
LinuxBridge: update status according to admin_state_up

Fixes bug 1099065

In addition to this the agent will only treat ports that exist on the agent.

Change-Id: I927649a45a860421ef0d825015516000475ad08d

commit_message:
Map libvirt error to InstanceNotFound in get_instance_disk_info

When getting instance disk info, the instance may be destroyed/deleted, and a
libvirtError will be raised in XMLDesc method, so catching and mapping it to
InstanceNotFound and the caller can handle it correctly.

Fixes bug #1064581

Change-Id: I07fed3e82e10dad4cb84ae5c8650ada351c24e78

commit_message:
Add Compute API validations for block device map

This patch adds validations to return 400 BadRequest to
Create server(s) with block device mappings where appropriate
and related unit tests

Fixes bug 1094244

Change-Id: I778d3ed4b0871561774594e950ce98b6a1ecfcb9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-18 16:01:46.000000000', 'message': 'XenAPI: Fix volume detach

fixes bug 1101229

The code-cleanup and code-move changes from this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19219/
introduced a problem: the volume_utils.find_sr_from_vbd method was
called after the vbd has already been destroyed. This change fixes the
issue by moving the sr discovery before the vbd destruction, and tests
the call order by using side effects.

Change-Id: Ide4f8ac810f98bb192909f5f0408affc940e7446
'}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: Fix volume detach

fixes bug 1101229

The code-cleanup and code-move changes from this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19219/
introduced a problem: the volume_utils.find_sr_from_vbd method was
called after the vbd has already been destroyed. This change fixes the
issue by moving the sr discovery before the vbd destruction, and tests
the call order by using side effects.

Change-Id: Ide4f8ac810f98bb192909f5f0408affc940e7446

commit_message:
Remove network manager from compute manager.

Remove an instance of the configured network manager from the compute
manager.  It's not used anywhere.  This was also the only place the
network_manager config option was used, so remove the config import as
well.

Change-Id: I8cfad16e96018e649dd223c3a7132a3860928c23

commit_message:
xenapi: Add cleanup_sm_locks script

XenServer 5.6 and 6.0 don't appear to be cleaning up sm locks when using
a FileSR. When enough locks accumulate, this causes image related
operations to fail.

This cleanup script is a stop-gap solution that can be run against all
of the dom0's in the cluster to prevent too many locks from
accumulating.

We can remove this script when the root-cause is fixed upstream.

References 1103158

Change-Id: I798bcfeb727a59003910b82d331fdbe031c4a2b4

[{'created': '2013-01-22 19:29:49.000000000', 'message': "Ensure service's servicegroup API is created first.

We want to make sure to create the servicegroup API instance early,
before creating other things such as the manager, that will also
create a servicegroup API instance.  Internally, the servicegroup
only allocates a single instance of the driver API and we want to
make sure that the service's value of db_allowed is there when
it gets created. For that to happen, when the service class creates
a servicegroup API instance, it needs to be the first thing to do so.

Part of bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I41df39d34c4920fcbfcd50c8f0344ee1dd5547d1
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure service's servicegroup API is created first.

We want to make sure to create the servicegroup API instance early,
before creating other things such as the manager, that will also
create a servicegroup API instance.  Internally, the servicegroup
only allocates a single instance of the driver API and we want to
make sure that the service's value of db_allowed is there when
it gets created. For that to happen, when the service class creates
a servicegroup API instance, it needs to be the first thing to do so.

Part of bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I41df39d34c4920fcbfcd50c8f0344ee1dd5547d1

In the dictionary CATEGORIES of file nova-manage, both 'flavor'
and 'instance_type' refer to InstanceTypeCommands, so the category
would be handled twice by add_command_parsers(). It would mess the

commit_message:
Fixed nova-manage argument parsing error

In the dictionary CATEGORIES of file nova-manage, both 'flavor'
and 'instance_type' refer to InstanceTypeCommands, so the category
would be handled twice by add_command_parsers(). It would mess the
arguments if a command category is handled more than once by
function add_command_parsers().
Added a check to avoid the mess.

Change-Id: I7a314a9b389b3dea848a7111cedfc762bbb6b30e
Fixes: bug #1098733

commit_message:
Adds SSL support for API server.

Part of code in test for accessing with ipv6 and part of ssl
socket wrapping developed by Davanum Srinivas.
Original patch could be found here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19559

DocImpact

Fixes bug 869884.

Change-Id: I6d60df77c3fb49552e597f94abae7f4d6f54044d

This is superfluous as the two dicts (self.engines and
self.test_databases) are re-initialised during setUp anyway and aren't
used in between

Change-Id: Icafa9bdf3b0193f31752e6104ecac0e49476c812
"}]
commit_message:
don't clear the database dicts in the tearDown method

This is superfluous as the two dicts (self.engines and
self.test_databases) are re-initialised during setUp anyway and aren't
used in between

Change-Id: Icafa9bdf3b0193f31752e6104ecac0e49476c812

'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2013-01-22 19:46:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think appending to pyflake's _MAGIC_GLOBALS is safer than messing around with __builtins__. See the example of how flake8 does this https://bitbucket.org/tarek/flake8/src/26153843d204e83cc92712bd66f71d0f8e8957ae/flake8/main.py?at=default#cl-46"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-01-22 20:44:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Jason, the link you included points to how flake8 uses _MAGIC_GLOBALS with flakey not pyflakes'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2013-01-22 20:49:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Same thing though, here is the commit from when they were using an embedded version of pyflakes directly:

https://bitbucket.org/tarek/flake8/src/b8fe4f73e6c3e875107640e6d26f19c2c7462b42/flake8/run.py#cl-52

The same method would work on the upstream version as well.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-01-22 21:04:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It looks like flake8 has its own pyflakes copy.  
pyflakes source according to pypi (
http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~divmod-dev/pyflakes/trunk/view/head:/pyflakes/scripts/pyflakes.py) doesn't have MAGIC_GLOBALS"}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2013-01-22 21:17:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

They moved it into the checker in trunk:

http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~divmod-dev/pyflakes/trunk/view/head:/pyflakes/checker.py#L178'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-01-22 21:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Adding REST API to show all availability zones of an region

Returns a summary or detailed list of availability zone to client.
To keep consistent result with EC2 API and de-duplicate, I have
refactored EC2 cloud controllor code.

Implement one workitem for bp:show-availability-zone

Change-Id: I6c9c673c757c6c319a1cdd94d7420b8983f92bbb
Signed-off-by: zhiyanliu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

[{'created': '2013-01-15 10:10:58.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure list output function can support non-sorting printing

Ensure list printing function in utils can handle non-sorting
calls. Allow result list can be formatted and outputted without any
sorting field, keep natural order to the list printing. Adding necessary
checking to avoid prettytable (0.6.1 for me) exception: "Invalid field
name: None!".

Fix bug: #1099732

Change-Id: Ied869d987e608fff8b8b5f5a65d21e02f0cebeaa

commit_message:
Ensure list output function can support non-sorting printing

Ensure list printing function in utils can handle non-sorting
calls. Allow result list can be formatted and outputted without any
sorting field, keep natural order to the list printing. Adding necessary
checking to avoid prettytable (0.6.1 for me) exception: "Invalid field
name: None!".

Fix bug: #1099732

Change-Id: Ied869d987e608fff8b8b5f5a65d21e02f0cebeaa
Signed-off-by: zhiyanliu <lzy.dev@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Validate numericness of ports in builder files.

You can't really goof this up using bin/swift-ring-builder, but if you
have code that uses swift.common.ring.RingBuilder directly, you can
stuff e.g. "6002" in where you mean 6002, resulting in some fairly
baffling failures. (Yes, I have done this.)

Change-Id: I87b7b7066b9ea2ce6f82255605da99cf0d283689

commit_message:
Change params for windows vm boot

fixes bug 1102516

As noted in the bug report, the existing command didn't work
as it was booting off the wrong drive and the syntax was wrong
for the drive parameter.

Change-Id: Ie76fd2f5e951271db2bc9550c520a55a209da788

commit_message:
Go back to the original branch after pylint check

Previously we save the current commit hash before running lintstack.
This is no problem for Jenkins but not very friendly if we run
lintstack locally. Every time after it's done, git is in detached
HEAD mode. This patch remembers the current branch name and
automatically go back to the branch if available. Otherwise we fall
back to the commit hash.

Part of blueprint lintstack

Change-Id: I145df3027022fc9a8302bc6da9ab300f677f3386

Thanks for the longer description, two things occur to me

 - Why was the failure to run resize2fs not detected ? It sounds like it failed, but nova went ahead and created the guest anyway. If correct, then is a bug that needs fixing too

 - Can we only use run_as_root=True, when we know we have LVM images, so we don't use elevated privileges in cases where we don't need them"}, {'account_id': 2468, 'date': '2013-01-18 16:43:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

>> - Why was the failure to run resize2fs not detected ? It sounds like it failed, but nova went ahead and created the guest anyway. If correct, then is a bug that needs fixing too

That is because check_exit_code is diabled when running resize2fs/fsck. That portion could be tricky because non-zero returning could be things like 'filesystem error corrected', and does no harm to current operation.

So, IMHO, disable check_exit_code for filesystem ops (resize2fs / e2fsck) is a reasonable choice here. Unless sometime we choose to finetune the logic according the return value. But that should be a story of another patch.

>> - Can we only use run_as_root=True, when we know we have LVM images, so we don't use elevated privileges in cases where we don't need them

Sure, nothing wrong to be prudent here. Revised the patch accordingly."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-01-18 16:45:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hmm, yes, detecting error codes is tricky. I wonder if there is another command we could run to explicitly query the size of the filesystem. If so, we could run that afterwards to validate that the resize command actually did what we expected.'}, {'account_id': 2468, 'date': '2013-01-18 16:46:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-18 17:09:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Run_as_root to ensure resize2fs succeed for all image backends

Unlike other file based image backend, operation over LVM
logical volumes requires root to functioning correctly. Resize2fs
on logical volumes also need run_as_root.

Otherwise, when running nova-compute as non-root user, instance
creation with flavor disk size larger than image size would fail.
Caused by resize2fs failure.

Fixes LP# 1101137

Change-Id: I16a2aa4382be58843270ff23e11bfb1e20c568d2

commit_message:
Refactor: extract method: driver_dict_from_config

Related to blueprint xenapi-volume-drivers

Extract method to create driver registries, so that it could be re-used
in xenapi for a similar purpose.

Change-Id: Ifd25d12335ac96a15dfea4c5ab7f315ff7ddfd8b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-11 17:02:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix state sync logic related to the PAUSED VM state

A VM may get into the paused state not only because the user request
via API calls, but also due to (temporary) external instrumentations.
Before the virt layer can reliably report the reason, we simply ignore
the state discrepancy. In many cases, the VM state will go back to
running after the external instrumentation is done.

Fix bug 1097806.

Change-Id: I8edef45d60fa79d6ddebf7d0438042a7b3986b55
'}]
commit_message:
Fix state sync logic related to the PAUSED VM state

A VM may get into the paused state not only because the user request
via API calls, but also due to (temporary) external instrumentations.
Before the virt layer can reliably report the reason, we simply ignore
the state discrepancy. In many cases, the VM state will go back to
running after the external instrumentation is done.

Fix bug 1097806.

Change-Id: I8edef45d60fa79d6ddebf7d0438042a7b3986b55

commit_message:
Use setup.py testr to run testr in run_tests.sh.

Using the setup.py testr command in run_tests.sh will sync run_tests.sh
up with the way tox currently runs the tests and collects coverage.

Change-Id: I21e3965280b3242a860c6be49c4dca44f197b03a

commit_message:
Fix the wrong datatype in task_log table.

    Change period_begining and period_ending to Datetime type.
    Add the migration script.

Change-Id: Ic5d61d6e7e847a1943825a0cb342b0b015bc0b70
Fixes: bug #1102477

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-22 00:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-22 00:36:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

If we use 'api.quantum.xxxxx' just after 'from openstack_dashboard import api', I got the following error.
I saw the same problem in api.glance.xxxx (as I commented in patch set 2). It seems to be required that we need to import modules directly: e.g. 'api.quantum' or 'api.glance'.

Thus I changed in patch set 4 to make sure that each module imports api.xxxx directly. (I used api_xxxx style just to avoid indentation cleanup)

Sorry for the big change.

---
Exception Type: 	AttributeError
Exception Value: 	'module' object has no attribute 'quantum'
Exception Location: 	/opt/stack/horizon/openstack_dashboard/wsgi/../../openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/views.py in _get_data, line 132
---"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-22 01:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/20085/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/2021 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2013-01-22 09:49:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I personally am not a big fan of the "import .. as .." statement except when it is unavoidable. Would also like to hear what other developers think of this. Otherwise, the error 

    module has no attribute...

can be avoided if in 

openstack_dashboard/api/__init__.py is being added the following:

    import base, cinder, glance, keystone, nova, quantum, swift

This will make them available when:

    from openstack_dashboard import api
    api.glance....
    api.nova....

This error also can appear when api is redefined in imported packages, but after briefly analyzing the project files, I couldn't find any other reference to api. Akihiro, would you please try to make a clone of the 3rd patch with just adding the import as defined above, and see if the error persists? If there is however any other code that raises the described error, I'd be OK with patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-01-22 10:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

Wow. a lot of cleaning up. I agree with Tihomir, I like patch set 3 better than 4.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-22 11:39:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-22 11:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Ensure to use api.<category>.<method>

In the current code both api.<method> and api.<category>.<method> are used.
Using api.<method> directly makes it difficult to identify which module
defined a method and forces developers to use unique method names among
projects. This commit removes api.<method> style method calls.

Change-Id: Iaefa1061f99b7865e02541df87c112a6b2868ec0

commit_message:
Allow snapshots of paused and suspended instances

Fixes bug 1100556

Remove the restriction in the API of snapshotting instances which
are in paused or suspended states and update the libvirt driver
to deal with this accordingly.

Other drivers may need to be updated accordingly.

Change-Id: Iabeb44f843c3c04f767c4103038fcf6c52966ff3

Cleanup of extract_opts.py

Moved global variables to the top.
Removed once used variables
Used option type definitions in OPT_TYPES

Change-Id: Ia0bf39933bac84dbf432e6b4590ceb2527e6889c

commit_message:
Allow callers to set log sanitization configuration.

Instead of hard coding everyone to nova's rules. Resolves the
oslonian bits of bug 1095587.

Change-Id: I194406568dd10889263a4fc5d52ec5f006880d8d

(3 inline comments)

so this is pretty extreme, going off and building new deb packages in a local repo.

Also, what's the fedora installation instructions?

Couple of inline comments, but I really think the cleanliness of reddwarf integration into multiple distros needs to be handled before it's devstack material."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-12-13 16:28:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(11 inline comments)

My initial concerns are with the structure and naming used in lib/reddwarf.  Some vars and functions have generic names yet are specific to reddwarf.  some other things really are generic and should be considered fro either functions or the project they are used with (I'm thinking of some of the keystone operations here).

The issue with factoring out apache configuration is another big concern and really should be solved first in another patch.  Otherwise reddwarf needs to be self-contained and defensive enough to tolerate horizon having configured apache first (you have this today) yet complete enough to handle when horizon is not present."}, {'account_id': 5293, 'date': '2012-12-18 01:51:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 5293, 'date': '2012-12-18 01:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2012-12-18 01:55:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

[{'created': '2012-12-13 00:06:33.000000000', 'message': 'Added reddwarf (database as a service) to devstack.
Fixes blueprint:reddwarf-devstack-integration (Integrate reddwarf into devstack)
  - Fixed reddwarf_install paths and environment variables so that code is cloned and prereqs are installed correctly.
  - Added support to devstack for "install", "configure", "init", and "run"
  - Fixed issues where the reddwarf users were not getting created correctly in keystone.
  - Support for new flavors for nova.
  - Removed extraneous apt-get packages.

commit_message:
Added reddwarf (database as a service).

Fixes blueprint:reddwarf-devstack-integration
(Integrate reddwarf into devstack -- under the reddwarf project)
  - Fixed reddwarf_install paths and environment variables so
    that code is cloned and prereqs are installed correctly.
  - Added support to devstack for "install", "configure",
    "init", and "run"
  - Fixed issues where the reddwarf users were not getting
    created correctly in keystone.
  - Support for new flavors for nova.
  - Removed extraneous apt-get packages.

Change-Id: Iad0f3fe3920ec086a96a7e506e0672a60f04f705

Since mongodb is used by ceilometer, this patch is to add mongodb
as a kind of database type for ceilometer convenience.

Since the other projects except ceilometer use relational databases
and support SQL only, mongodb can't be set as the database type for
them in devstack until they support it in the future.

Change-Id: I22faae2086711f1b98734d43c572dbcf1dc32adb
Signed-off-by: Hongna Xu <hongnax.xu@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add mongodb as a kind of supported database type for ceilometer

Since mongodb is used by ceilometer, this patch is to add mongodb
as a kind of database type for ceilometer convenience.

Since the other projects except ceilometer use relational databases
and support SQL only, mongodb can't be set as the database type for
them in devstack until they support it in the future.

Change-Id: I22faae2086711f1b98734d43c572dbcf1dc32adb
Signed-off-by: Hongna Xu <hongnax.xu@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

SQL Primary Keys cannot be null, so this patch fixes an
inconsistency between the models and SQL.  The databases were
correcting this automatically, so a migration is not required.

commit_message:
set allocation_pool_id nullable=False

fixes bug 1103216

SQL Primary Keys cannot be null, so this patch fixes an
inconsistency between the models and SQL.  The databases were
correcting this automatically, so a migration is not required.

Change-Id: I724294580de9b86a2edfd4fdc6907e9469b6c552

Juergen, there are a lot of disscuss on maillist, could you please reference ML, http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-November/003559.html'}, {'account_id': 6139, 'date': '2013-01-23 04:03:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think there is absolutely no reason at all why LOG messages should be internationalized.

Furthermore, I doubt the usefulness of any internationalization in a technical product like OpenStack, this is not Facebook or some other consumer facing product we are talking about here. It's used by technical folks, who deal with the (non-internationalized) Linux command line, necessarily read non-internationalized documentation about OpenStack, etc.

Internationalization for OpenStack just adds entirely unnecessary complexity, I think."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-23 04:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-23 04:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

I think there is absolutely no reason at all why LOG messages should be internationalized.

Furthermore, I doubt the usefulness of any internationalization in a technical product like OpenStack, this is not Facebook or some other consumer facing product we are talking about here. It's used by technical folks, who deal with the (non-internationalized) Linux command line, necessarily read non-internationalized documentation about OpenStack, etc.

Internationalization for OpenStack just adds entirely unnecessary complexity, I think."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-23 03:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

[{'created': '2013-01-22 23:14:57.000000000', 'message': "add numpy to package list, saves lots of time

websockify was added to the pip requires, and it has a dependency
of numpy. Because we didn't specify it in the package list, it was
built from source every time, adding 3 minutes to an average run.

Stop testing whether numpy compiles 100 times a day in CI.

Change-Id: Ic9d9b8135a917deb846911c6b266aec87d05781a
"}]
commit_message:
add numpy to package list, saves lots of time

websockify was added to the pip requires, and it has a dependency
of numpy. Because we didn't specify it in the package list, it was
built from source every time, adding 3 minutes to an average run.

Stop testing whether numpy compiles 100 times a day in CI.

Change-Id: Ic9d9b8135a917deb846911c6b266aec87d05781a

Use the default bit length of the underlying ssh-keygen command
(currently 2048) if no bit length is supplied, rather than defaulting to
1024 bits.

bug 1103130

Change-Id: Iba9d378d5bf9e28663e52180ed04c31c16d08aad
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Don't limit SSH keys generation to 1024 bits

Use the default bit length of the underlying ssh-keygen command
(currently 2048) if no bit length is supplied, rather than defaulting to
1024 bits.

bug 1103130

Change-Id: Iba9d378d5bf9e28663e52180ed04c31c16d08aad
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-22 03:09:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix nova coverage.

Nova coverage was broken because additional coverage tests were added
that interfere with collecting coverage during unit testing. These new
tests were not properly excluded by the coverage unit test regex. Modify
the regex to exclude any tests of the form '.*test.*coverage.*'. This
allows `tox -ecover` and `run_tests.sh --coverage` to run properly.

Change-Id: Id35f50ec335707c9eadb0e7fb3aa0833661f7333
"}]
commit_message:
Fix nova coverage.

Nova coverage was broken because additional coverage tests were added
that interfere with collecting coverage during unit testing. These new
tests were not properly excluded by the coverage unit test regex. Modify
the regex to exclude any tests of the form '.*test.*coverage.*'. This
allows `tox -ecover` and `run_tests.sh --coverage` to run properly.

Change-Id: Id35f50ec335707c9eadb0e7fb3aa0833661f7333

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-22 19:43:31.000000000', 'message': 'Make compare_result show the difference in lists

If two lists had differed because one had an extra element, both lists
would be included in the exception message. If the lists were large (for
example the list of extensions) it could be very difficult trying to
figure out what is different between the two lists.

This change will show the items that only exist in the expected and/or
result and not the other list.

Change-Id: I6102faea037b4f5e31361adc9db81e79592b7008
'}]
commit_message:
Make compare_result show the difference in lists

If two lists had differed because one had an extra element, both lists
would be included in the exception message. If the lists were large (for
example the list of extensions) it could be very difficult trying to
figure out what is different between the two lists.

This change will show the items that only exist in the expected and/or
result and not the other list.

Change-Id: I6102faea037b4f5e31361adc9db81e79592b7008

different flavor names for each individual test. This allows them
to be run in parallel without them interfering with each other.

commit_message:
Add script to validate files are valid DocBook.

Adds a script called tools/validate.py that will check all XML
files against the DocBook 5 RELAX NG schema.

Does not check pom.xml files or files inside of directories named
"target".

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/18170

Change-Id: I9614f1b10ac2da608a245c7644309a5be38c8995

commit_message:
List servers having non-existent flavor should return empty list

When we catch the exception just return an empty list.

Fixes LP# 1102462

Change-Id: I730bd505c40fa76cb0ba687575e3c3882fee6254

commit_message:
Support Port Binding Extension in NEC plugin

Fixes bug 1099894
nova/network/quantumv2/api fill the bridge name according to
binding:vif_type attribute passed from Quantum. Otherwise the bridge
is set to None and launching an instance will fail.

blueprint vif-plugging-improvements

Note that binding:capabilities is under discussion and it may be
changed in the future. This commit just adds NEC plugin support
same as OVS and Linux bridge plugin.

Change-Id: Ifd43c3c53615246187621613f72490b62a09b2d6

commit_message:
Prevent metadata updates until instance is active.

This avoids a race condition where setting metadata too early in the
build process can cause a build failure due to the VM not existing
in Xen.

bug 1100866

Change-Id: I702128799997d91d5f0c0ac189f619bfdf011988

commit_message:
Tests for PXE bare-metal provisioning helper server.

a part of blueprint general-bare-metal-provisioning-framework.

The deploy helper was landed without tests. This patch reinstates the
tests.

Change-Id: I690ec077e175dc37c2cc5f18170513b0e5bca103
Co-authored-by: Mikyung Kang <mkkang@isi.edu>
Co-authored-by: David Kang <dkang@isi.edu>
Co-authored-by: Ken Igarashi <igarashik@nttdocomo.co.jp>
Co-authored-by: Arata Notsu <notsu@virtualtech.jp>
Co-authored-by: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>

Code looks good. Just a couple of general concerns.

1) is this patch going to play nice with V3 policies and credentials APIs where the request body can be legitimately large? Should RequestBodySizeLimiter be a bit more flexible to look for certain type of requests rather indiscriminately at the request body?
2) do we have the same problem with really large headers, like PKI tokens?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-01-22 14:29:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

guang-yee:

1) The default max request size limit is a generous 112k. Do we expect v3 policies and credentials to be larger than that?

2) I believe Eventlets WSGI defaults cover us in terms of checking max header size. See below:

Looking at the source for Eventlets wsgi.py shows:

 MAX_HEADER_LINE = 8192

 MAX_TOTAL_HEADER_SIZE = 65536

 url_length_limit=MAX_REQUEST_LINE (which is set to 8192 by default...)'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-01-22 15:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-01-22 19:06:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: No score

I would prefer to make RequestBodySizeLimiter configurable. Like what method and what APIs it is interested in. But I don't really have any strong objection with the code as is."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-22 19:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

commit_message:
Limit the size of HTTP requests.

Adds a new RequestBodySizeLimiter middleware to guard against
really large HTTP requests. The default max request size is 112k
although this limit is configurable via the 'max_request_body_size'
config parameter.

Fixes LP Bug #1099025.

Change-Id: Id51be3d9a0d829d63d55a92dca61a39a17629785

commit_message:
Add python-keystoneclient dependency to pip-requires.

since we are using the keystoneclient library for our 2.0 authentication,
so add python-keystoneclient dependency.

Fix bug #1102322

Change-Id: Ifce24bdfc1736fb160a5383bf26dc5f1e5b11843

commit_message:
Drop volume API

When volumes were removed from nova, api-paste.ini was not updated.
This removes the outdated sections of api-paste.ini.

Change-Id: I6dcc792ed87f6b02e5fdffb0af46a3fbf6b37404

commit_message:
make IPv6 unit test work on systems with eth0

fixes bug 1103074

The link local unit test was failing because it depended on eth0 to
exists.  This mocks getaddrinfo() to ensure a consistent return value
across testing environments.

Change-Id: Ie1a4d837efcacac8c8d2217c164ad751922e1a5f

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-21 01:09:05.000000000', 'message': 'Refactoring XML generation.

Fixes bug 1081373

Change-Id: I4aa1068fa3aa54fdb7e690d46b6cf2e41bb20bc9
'}, {'created': '2012-11-21 05:29:40.000000000', 'message': "More consistent libvirt XML handling and cleanup

Fixes bug 1081373

The overall goal of this effort is to make handling of libvirt XMLs
more consistent. First, the on-disk XML file in the instances
directory is never to be used by the libvirt driver. It will be
generated via to_xml(). Second, anytime it is safe to re-define the
XML using the version we programatically generate, we do so.

Extended to_xml() to support a new write_to_disk argument. When true,
this the resulting XML will be written to the instances directory.
Renamed _get_domain_xml to _get_existing_domain_xml, as it should only
be used when we need the XML for a defined domain. It will continue to
fall back to using to_xml() if the defined version is not available.

Hard reboots will now assume nothing about the defined state within
libvirt. Rather, we generate and define the domain every time. This
eliminates the possibility of the hypervisor and Nova database going
out of sync (i.e. volume attached in defined XML with Nova having no
knowledge). We no longer need to pass an xml argument into
_hard_reboot() since it is always generated.

Resume state on boot has been updated with logic similar to that of
_hard_reboot. Again, after a hypervisor reboot (or detection of downed
VMs on compute start), we should not assume the defined XML is valid.
The state or configuration of the VM, from Nova's perspective, may
have been changed while the system was down.

The post_live_migration_on_destination() method used to call to_xml()
without block_device_info. This would result in an on-disk XML without
any volume mappings. The compute manager has been updated to pass bdi
so that this XML can be generated and written correctly. The Mox stub
for this function has been replaced by a stub in the fake virt driver.

Change-Id: I4aa1068fa3aa54fdb7e690d46b6cf2e41bb20bc9

commit_message:
More consistent libvirt XML handling and cleanup

Fixes bug 1081373

The overall goal of this effort is to make handling of libvirt XMLs
more consistent. First, the on-disk XML file in the instances
directory is never to be used by the libvirt driver. It will be
generated via to_xml(). Second, anytime it is safe to re-define the
XML using the version we programatically generate, we do so.

Extended to_xml() to support a new write_to_disk argument. When true,
this the resulting XML will be written to the instances directory.
Renamed _get_domain_xml to _get_existing_domain_xml, as it should only
be used when we need the XML for a defined domain. It will continue to
fall back to using to_xml() if the defined version is not available.

Hard reboots will now assume nothing about the defined state within
libvirt. Rather, we generate and define the domain every time. This
eliminates the possibility of the hypervisor and Nova database going
out of sync (i.e. volume attached in defined XML with Nova having no
knowledge). We no longer need to pass an xml argument into
_hard_reboot() since it is always generated.

Resume state on boot has been updated with logic similar to that of
_hard_reboot. Again, after a hypervisor reboot (or detection of downed
VMs on compute start), we should not assume the defined XML is valid.
The state or configuration of the VM, from Nova's perspective, may
have been changed while the system was down.

The post_live_migration_on_destination() method used to call to_xml()
without block_device_info. This would result in an on-disk XML without
any volume mappings. The compute manager has been updated to pass bdi
so that this XML can be generated and written correctly. The Mox stub
for this function has been replaced by a stub in the fake virt driver.

Change-Id: I4aa1068fa3aa54fdb7e690d46b6cf2e41bb20bc9

commit_message:
prevent irregular auth_prefix config in tempauth

Tempauth handles a authorization request by request path.
If a request's path start with auth_prefix, tempauth middleware
handles that request to authorization method.
Therefore, when configuring auth_prefix to '/', all requests
handle to authorization method.

This change enables tempauth to prevent invalid auth_prefix
config '/' and similar empty auth_prefix in initialization method.

Fixes bug #1096538.

Change-Id: I20b157e2a0809c17409fc65a8eff0858fe4aff29

commit_message:
fix mysql race in tests

because of testr, we can't assume the migrations tests run in
sequence, so they make run all at the same time. This is fine for
our in memory sqlite db, but when talking to a real external
database, not so good.

Since a second mysql test was added, we started racing on these
migrations them often hitting at the same time causing random fails
in gate.

Fix this by moving all the mysql tests into 1 test function, so we
won't race.

Fixes bug #1101874

Change-Id: I7627f3bd510266c99af018d355f960b352573759

commit_message:
Enhance wsgi to listen on ipv6 address

Check if the hostname is ipv6 and set the family appropriately.
Picked up the code snippet from glance to determine the address_family
per markmclain's comment
Picked up some code from nova as well to get the test case running
properly

Fixes LP# 1101341

Change-Id: I67166dc030e4ea0dd82888abfbc9db555747de27

commit_message:
Fix incorrect use of context object

As in nova/availability_zones.py, the method get_host_availability_zone()
expects "context" as a module rather than a RequestContext object.
But for our preference, the argument "context" is better to be a
RequestContext object. So fix this by passing an context object into the
method.

* Fix the usage of argument "context"
* Add unittest for the module "availability_zones"

Fix bug lp:#1100598

Change-Id: I5886ba26131261d97be65f18e9492c40401c5a7f

commit_message:
heat rename HEAT::HA::Restarter resource

Rename HEAT::HA::Restarter to OS::Heat::HARestarter, which fits
better with the other openstack-native resources which use the
OS:: namespace

Change-Id: I40038e64979aca184971b11e83f6ef92a3b54571
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-01-03 15:40:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-03 15:43:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

You need to keep the old method around on the manager side. You don't need to keep it around on the client side

i.e. retain it in network/manager.py but you can remove it from network/rpcapi.py

Also, in rpcapi.py you should pass version=1.6 to the call

Basically, you want to allow updating the manager side before updating the client side - the manager needs to continue supporting old 1.x clients until we bump the major version

By passing version=1.6 in rpcapi, the client is requiring the manager to be updated to support version 1.6"}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-01-10 06:35:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Fix get Floating ip pools action name to match with its policy

Get Floating IP Pools is always responding 403 (Forbidden) cause its method
name, which is also being used as action name, doesn't match with the name in
policy.json file.
I opted for this approach cause it also fixes the different names between the
extension (which is named floating **ip** pools instead of floating pools) and
the backend.
Another good practice would be change the default_floating_pool option to
default_float_ip_pool, but that would require change the conf file and possibly
break some compatibility.

Fixes bug 1091668

Change-Id: I2627e8b0f45c5c39bbbf1a4a12b448e1992fa4b4

commit_message:
fix floating ip test that wasn't running

the associate_floating_ip negative test wasn't running because
the indent was wrong. This was uncovered when looking for unknown
names with pyflakes.

This makes the test run, and fixes the mispelling of floating to
make it actually pass.

Change-Id: I74397b8592d51a7fed249c96f17d3e71cdf82a7e

commit_message:
heat_keystoneclient make token auth work

username/password are ignored so don't pass them, and
tenant needs to be the context tenant not the service
tenant or token auth will fail.

Fixes bug 1072944

Change-Id: I862d0041daad278dfe7bc16d59dc733dde90e758
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-22 16:36:48.000000000', 'message': 'heat api paste.ini auth_uri should use auth_port

For token based auth to work, the auth_uri needs to use
auth_port, which points at the internalURL of the keystone
service, the current config uses publicURL which causes
token auth requests to keystone to fail

ref bug 1072944

Change-Id: If7e0c2246205377f57f879ccf8bf36ff8b0d92e1
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat api paste.ini auth_uri should use auth_port

For token based auth to work, the auth_uri needs to use
auth_port, which points at the internalURL of the keystone
service, the current config uses publicURL which causes
token auth requests to keystone to fail

ref bug 1072944

Change-Id: If7e0c2246205377f57f879ccf8bf36ff8b0d92e1
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-21 15:35:52.000000000', 'message': 'Disable domain does not cascade

As gyee pointed out in a related review[1], disabling a domain does not
need to cascade to owned projects/users as the effect of disabling a
domain only needs to be enforced service-side when a user is requesting
auth.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19787/

Change-Id: Ibd9882bdb933381f26a9ac4daf7e78ddf5dc53b3
'}]
commit_message:
Disable domain does not cascade

As gyee pointed out in a related review[1], disabling a domain does not
need to cascade to owned projects/users as the effect of disabling a
domain only needs to be enforced service-side when a user is requesting
auth.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19787/

Change-Id: Ibd9882bdb933381f26a9ac4daf7e78ddf5dc53b3

commit_message:
heat engine : make WatchRule initial state NODATA

Initial state should be NODATA not NORMAL, as we've not
done any metric evaluation until the first evaluation
period has elapsed

fixes bug 1102446

Change-Id: Ic41df29c00a5df2f3d161bc1b1d054d816c5afa5
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-21 23:42:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix superfluous GET requests in swift-bench.

If you specified num_gets = 0 for a benchmarking run (say, if you're
benchmarking PUT rate), you'd still get each swift-bench-client
process doing 1 GET request. Now you don't.

This should also fix the case where you've got more objects than
swift-bench-client processes, for example when you're uploading a few
large objects and then doing lots of parallel GETs of those
objects. Now you'll get the number requested, not
max(number-requested, number-of-bench-clients).

Change-Id: Ied9eb733dd9af51a3c6af8b815ad6cff0ff746b7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix superfluous GET requests in swift-bench.

If you specified num_gets = 0 for a benchmarking run (say, if you're
benchmarking PUT rate), you'd still get each swift-bench-client
process doing 1 GET request. Now you don't.

This should also fix the case where you've got more objects than
swift-bench-client processes, for example when you're uploading a few
large objects and then doing lots of parallel GETs of those
objects. Now you'll get the number requested, not
max(number-requested, number-of-bench-clients).

Change-Id: Ied9eb733dd9af51a3c6af8b815ad6cff0ff746b7

commit_message:
Move scheduler_topic into nova.scheduler.rpcapi

The scheduler_topic opt is only used in nova.scheduler.rpcapi and it
makes sense for the RPC module to "own" the topic option.

blueprint: scope-config-opts
Change-Id: Iafb8705eb716b650b63e060fe1dd36666bcee812

commit_message:
Define a hypervisor driver method for getting MAC addresses.

This lets hypervisors export the MAC addresses an instance needs to have (or
return the default of None if the hypervisor is not constrained by MAC
addresses).  being provisioned.

Change-Id: I319a8deb2d09fbf8cecb7071256cf931924ef0e9

commit_message:
Corrected get_raw_event() in sqlalchemy.

This fixed bug 1101100. The returned dict of get_raw_event() in sqlalchemy
should be consistent with one generated by
collector.meter.meter_message_from_counter().

Change-Id: I6948fdbd0c1e03d46be7d3a05faa53ca70698ce8

commit_message:
Higher level test for db backends.

This patch implemented the blueprint test-db-backends, and also fixed
the bug 1085111.

Note: Some test cases in RawEventTest are still db backend dependendant
due to the bug 1101100. We could move them to base class after we
resolve that bug.

Change-Id: Ic32a7f0719d34a008cc21ddd59c9912d9a90db24

--jyh"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-09-11 06:01:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

the data from the services and compute node table is already passed into the filter. Isn't that enough? You shouldn't need to make another db request."}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-09-11 08:36:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for response. I think the filter_scheduler only pass data about one host to the filter's function, the data of host that would be filtered. Not whole data from services and compute node table.

Or you mean we can change the filter_scheduler.py to passing the unfiltered_hosts_dict or filtered_hosts through filter_property to filter functions?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-09-11 10:13:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why do you need more than the current host? The method is called for every host, so each call can update/check the cast for this host without having to update all hosts at once.'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-09-11 14:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Vish, the reason is, currently each time the trusted_filter is called, it will need poll the OAT service to check the trust level. As described in previous reply, polling OAT service may take several hundred ms to several seconds, depends on the OAT service configuration and strategy.

 This will be a huge problem if the host number is big, like 200 host machine. It may takes one minutes in good situation (200 * 300 ms),or 10 minutes in bad situation (200 * 3s), to finish the polling for all host, for only one instance launch.'}, {'account_id': 1981, 'date': '2012-09-12 15:04:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

To expand upon what Yunhong said, the problem is that each call to the attestation service takes upwards of a few seconds, whether you are attesting 1 host or a 100.  By calling the DB to find all of the compute nodes we can then fill up the cache with one call to the attestation service and satisfy subsequent sequential scheduler calls to the filter immediately out of the cache.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-09-13 01:34:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

Don: ah ok, I finally understand the rationale for the db call. It is so you can attest the whole list at once. In that case I'm ok with this, but it needs to wait for grizzly to open."}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-09-26 00:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-12-28 01:01:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Testing shows that filters are reinitialized for each VM that is scheduled.  Meaning that as far as I can tell adding a cache here wouldn't reduce the amount of calls to the OAT service."}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-12-28 01:27:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Joe, thanks for the review. 

It's known that the cache is only valid for one VM instance scheduling. However, without this cache support, we need consult the OAT service for each host checking even in the one VM instance scheduling. This is a big impact.

We also discussed internally if we need global cache and the conclusion is global cache has benefit but also has side effect, so not support it at least in the first step. Also the OAT service itself can be enhanced to keep cache, so that the global cache benefit in openstack will be small."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-12-28 01:55:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

If the cache is only used for scheduling a single VM, why have a 'attestation_auth_timeout'?

Furthermore could you clarify why this helps scheduling? Don't you still have the same number of calls to OAT?

And lastly what is the benefit of having the caching logic here instead of OAT?"}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-12-28 02:10:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> If the cache is only used for scheduling a single VM, why have a 'attestation_auth_timeout'?

If the host farm is large enough (like >1k), we will possibly hit the timeout even for one VM scheduling.

> Furthermore could you clarify why this helps scheduling? Don't you still have the same number of calls to OAT?

Currently, the host_passes() will be invoked for each host in a single VM scheduling, and for each invocation, we have to consult the OAT. With this cache, we get all hosts in the host farm during the __init__() of ComputeAttestationCache , thus, in the first consult to the OAT, we will fetch back the attestation status for all host, thus don't need consult OAT services anymore for followed host_passes() invocation.


> And lastly what is the benefit of having the caching logic here instead of OAT?

Yes, OAT can have cache also, but that's a separated story to this one. The OAT can have cache support to enhance the performance, while OAT can have cache also to reduce in OAT side."}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-12-28 02:11:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

For the last sentence in previous comments, I mean"
The OAT can have cache support to enhance the performance, while Openstack can have cache also to reduce in Openstack side"'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-12-28 02:26:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Ahh I see,  so you are batching the calls to OAT.  Instead of N requests for one machine each, you have 1 request for N machines.

LGTM,   The commit msg could be clearer though."}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-12-28 02:45:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-12-28 02:47:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Thanks for the review and suggestion. I updated the commit message accordingly.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-28 03:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

commit_message:
Add trust level cache to trusted_filter

    Currently each time the trusted filter is called to check host_pass, it
polls Open Attestation Service to get the trusted level for the host. This
solution is not good on scalability.
    With a cache for the host trust level, trusted filter don't need to
consult OAT service if the cache is still valid, thus improves the
scalability. The cache is setup when the first time the filter consulting
the OAT service.
    The trusted_filters are reinitialized for each VM that is
scheduled, thus the cache is valid only for one VM instance scheduing.

    Implements blueprint trusted-filter-cache

Change-Id: I613da53876e6cd548566e27ab1693287023e9861
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add capability to update volume metadata.

This addresses some cleanup and bugs with volume metadata updates
on the cinder side.  Mostly this implements v1/volume_metadata api
and adds things like propery checks to cinder.volume.api.update_volume_meta.

NOTE: This is only for api V1, a seperate patch will be provided for
V2 once this lands.

The remainder of the bp will be implemented in a cinderclient patch to follow.
Implement cinder side of blueprint update-vol-metadata

Also fixes bug: 1096018

Change-Id: Ie11931f657d3dcd69680fe5fcae435ff89549d97

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-03 15:09:59.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor EC2 keypairs exception

According to the following document:

http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/api-error-codes.html

The EC2 API sends specific error codes when keypair listing or
keypair generation fails, specifically the error codes are

InvalidKeyPair.Duplicate - duplicate keypair
InvalidKeyPair.Format - keypair format invalid
InvalidKeyPair.NotFound - keypair not found
ResourceLimitExceeded - keypair quota exceeded

Refactored create_key_pair and describe_key_pair so that
it throws the correct EC2 error codes according to the
public EC2 API specs.

Also removed some duplicate exceptions as well.

Change-Id: Ib7045e49211d9300e9cb6ca0bfe80e569d635c9b
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-01-03 16:10:46.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor EC2 keypairs exception

The EC2 API sends specific error codes when keypair listing or
keypair generation fails, specifically the error codes are

InvalidKeyPair.Duplicate - duplicate keypair
InvalidKeyPair.Format - keypair format invalid
InvalidKeyPair.NotFound - keypair not found
ResourceLimitExceeded - keypair quota exceeded

Refactored create_key_pair and describe_key_pair so that
it throws the correct EC2 error codes according to the
public EC2 API specs.

Also removed some duplicate exceptions as well.

Fixes LP: 1072318

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib7045e49211d9300e9cb6ca0bfe80e569d635c9b
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor EC2 keypairs exception

According to the following document:

http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/api-error-codes.html

The EC2 API sends specific error codes when keypair listing or
keypair generation fails, specifically the error codes are

InvalidKeyPair.Duplicate - duplicate keypair
InvalidKeyPair.Format - keypair format invalid
InvalidKeyPair.NotFound - keypair not found
ResourceLimitExceeded - keypair quota exceeded

Refactored create_key_pair and describe_key_pair so that
it throws the correct EC2 error codes according to the
public EC2 API specs.

Also removed some duplicate exceptions as well.

Fixes LP: 1072318

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib7045e49211d9300e9cb6ca0bfe80e569d635c9b
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Remove baremetal-compute-pxe.filters

The baremetal PXE driver doesn't seem to run dnsmasq at all, so remove
the rootwrap filter which allows it to do so. This was introduced by
commit a2f260f.

Change-Id: I4cc1127222b73af218a6a8808d0ad54478878af1

commit_message:
Enable ZeroMQ tests

ZeroMQ tests were not enabled as the
required library was not installed to
the tox environment. This change will
re-enable zeromq messaging tests for
both local development and jenkins.

Change-Id: Icffbffcb2b83c74f06075d93e1397c5c9b511a67

subject: Fix NFS volume creation
messages:

'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-01-21 15:18:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

A couple of things.

1. You should reference the bug in the commit message.  On a line before the Change-Id put "Fixes bug 1102051" or something similar.  This will add a link to the bug for people to see.

2. As mentioned in the bug report, you should fix this in oslo first, and then sync it to nova.  See https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/openstack/common/README.  My understanding of the process is that you'll need to propose this fix to oslo-incubator first, and if it merges there then run the update.py script in that repo to apply the fix to nova.  Then open another review with the changes from that script.'}, {'account_id': 1075, 'date': '2013-01-22 05:29:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks, I will transfer this merge req to oslo.'}, {'account_id': 1075, 'date': '2013-01-22 05:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

This merge req should transfer to oslo.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-20 13:42:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Lack of reconnecting operation when using rabbitmq mirrored queue

On using Mirrored Queue feature in impl_kombu.py, there is a case
that messages are lost because amqp client does not handle exceptions
properly when rabbitmq is dead on the way to waiting return value of call().
This patch is to handle exceptions properly that enables ampq client
reconnecting slave rabbitmq.

Change-Id: I37039967201d15a3da4ace4b44468a1748202303
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Lack of reconnecting operation when using rabbitmq mirrored queue

On using Mirrored Queue feature in impl_kombu.py, there is a case
that messages are lost because amqp client does not handle exceptions
properly when rabbitmq is dead on the way to waiting return value of call().
This patch is to handle exceptions properly that enables ampq client
reconnecting slave rabbitmq.

Change-Id: I37039967201d15a3da4ace4b44468a1748202303

commit_message:
Added rabbit configuration options to cinder

For those who have configured nova to use the non-default rabbit
configuration, will need to configure cinder with these settings.
I found it difficult to find these options, so wanted to be sure
they are easially available.

Change-Id: I4ff312105051b0db50c03759994834c0415b4ad9
