revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-21 16:57:26.000000000', 'message': "Move logging config options into the log module

We learned a lesson in Nova - it's best to declare and use config
options within a single module if possible. Globally declared and
use config options grow like weeds and it becomes harder to find out
if, where and how individual options are used.

Strangely, in cfg itself, we randomly declare a bunch of logging options
which are only used within the openstack.common.log module - let's move
the options there and remove the CommonConfigOpts class before they
become part of the API we commit to when oslo-config is released.

A minor detail in the patch - the logfile and logdir options are already
deprecated in favour of log_file and log_dir, but we never got around to
removing all other traces of the deprecated options.

Change-Id: I3913ea54465658d93dc56e014dfe5d911b0541d6
"}]
commit_message:
Move logging config options into the log module

We learned a lesson in Nova - it's best to declare and use config
options within a single module if possible. Globally declared and
use config options grow like weeds and it becomes harder to find out
if, where and how individual options are used.

Strangely, in cfg itself, we randomly declare a bunch of logging options
which are only used within the openstack.common.log module - let's move
the options there and remove the CommonConfigOpts class before they
become part of the API we commit to when oslo-config is released.

A minor detail in the patch - the logfile and logdir options are already
deprecated in favour of log_file and log_dir, but we never got around to
removing all other traces of the deprecated options.

Change-Id: I3913ea54465658d93dc56e014dfe5d911b0541d6

subject: Use revno and git sha for pre-release versioning.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 24, 'name': 'Chuck Short', 'email': 'charles.short@windriver.com', 'username': 'zulcss'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 4375, 'name': 'Sascha Peilicke', 'email': 'sascha@peilicke.de', 'username': 'saschpe'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}]

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-17 18:03:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/19957/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/455 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19957/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/640 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19957/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pyflakes/415 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19957/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/640 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19957/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/640 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-01-17 18:07:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Not a fan...

As someone who builds upstream tarballs I've come to rely on git describe --always.

If I understand this correctly... the tarballs I generate will be generated with just a hash... and not something that resembles the latest tag + the commit has.

For python-keystoneclient:

git describe --always
0.2.2-5-g3dfb843

vs.

git log -n1 --pretty=format:%h
3dfb843"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-18 07:23:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Hmm, I don't love the tarball names we're producing now but the extra metadata from git-describe --always seems useful to me too

What confusion is it providing?

Would ttx's idea of using 2013.1~g2 as the tag name help?"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-18 07:23:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-01-18 08:17:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We can't use 2013.1~g3 since tags can't contain ~. Actually the version we'll have to generate (and hence the tag) will be something like 2013.1.a3 to be compatible with Python versioning.

"Last tag + hash" is unfortunately not that meaningful for master branch, since tags land in the milestone-proposed branch. Even if we merge tags from MP back to master (which adds a rather hazardous step to the release process), it doesn't work that well. For example when we open "H" development at RC time, last tag for master will still be "2013.1.a3"... while master already accepts H features. So you continue to generate 2013.1.a3+sha and it contains features that will never land in 2013.1. Personally I find it much more confusing than just using SHA for random between-milestones tarballs built from master ?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-18 09:01:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Put it this way - I think a tarball snapshot of 2013.1 development should have knowledge that it's a 2013.1 snapshot not just a random git commit id with no other context

Pretty much every project I can think of that I've worked on has a version number checked into git. That's either a version number you bump at the start of a development cycle or at release time. We're trying to figure out how to get that information from git tags alone.

We want to take the approach where the release number bumps at the start of the development cycle - we don't like the idea of tarballs purporting to be a snapshot of 2012.2 tarball containing 2013.1 features

(Incidentally, projects like the kernel and libvirt work this way - if you look at a development snapshot, you know it's a snapshot of the *next* version rather than the version encoded in the snapshot. That's fine, so long as the project is consistent about it. You can figure out what the thing is by knowing how the project works and looking at the version number in the snapshot)

Ok, so we want to bump the version number at the start of a development cycle. But we don't want to that by modifying a file in git.

That would mean tagging the first commit in a development cycle e.g.

       	  B
        /-o <- folsom milestone-proposed
 o--o--o--o <- grizzly master
       A  C

i.e. commit A is the last commit in the folsom dev branch before master became the grizzly dev branch

If you check out B or C, or build a snapshot tarball from either commit, the only way we can automatically know what version either commit is working towards is by tagging those commits - e.g. you'd tag C with 2013.1-dev and B with 2012.2-dev tags

However, what would B and C contain? We need to wait around for the first commit on those branches before tagging them?

...

Rmind me again what was so bad about having the version checked into git itself?"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-01-18 09:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The original point was to let us get rid of the milestone-bump mechanism and "FINAL=True" change, and be able to use tagging to signal release points instead. I don't think there is anything really bad with the main version being checked in code.

So we can have a middle ground where we get rid of the milestone-bump stuff but where the main version still is specified in code.

We'd have VERSION="2013.1" in code somewhere, generate PROJECT-VERSION-SHA tarballs from random points (rather than PROJECT-LASTTAG.num.SHA) and for tagged revisions we'd generate PROJECT-TAG.tar.gz. My only gripe in that would be that VERSION in code would not serve any purpose except generate a prefix in random tarballs people could generate -- just not sure it's worth the trouble of updating it all the time.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-01-18 09:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Though if that version showed up in startup logs that could be useful. I prefer to see glance-2013.1~12356fa234ca345f as a version identified in logs than glance-12356fa234ca345f. Would that involve the return of the infamous versioninfo ?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-18 13:02:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Having VERSION in the code isn't so much my concern as what version number we pass to setuptools in setup.py

If someone wants to argue that the version number passed to setuptoosl isn't important, then the argument should be to not pass it anything or pass it something bogus :)

Assuming it has some importance, I'd prefer it to be a static version number with no git commit id than just a git commit id

If we took that simple approach, it's the person or jenkins job that created the tarball who is responsible for recording the commit id of the snapshot by e.g. renaming the tarball."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-01-18 13:48:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I can definitely live with pushing VERSION somewhere to development branches when they open, then use that when random tarballs are generated (glance-2013.1-dev.tar.gz or glance-2013.1~1671f235de.tar.gz with a glance-2013.1-dev/ or glance-2013.1/ or glance-2013.1~1671f235d/ top directory inside, whatever makes the most sense for you). When a tarball is generated from a tagged rev, we'd generate glance-$TAG.tar.gz with glance-$TAG (or glance-2013.1/, whatever makes the most sense) top directory.

What I want to avoid is the current tag+postversion approach which creates issues at edge cases (needs tags to be merged back to master, forces us to create a dummy tag when we open a new development series just to generate right version numbers in those tarballs). That feels like we're just trading a complex milestone-bump mechanism for another."}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2013-01-18 15:03:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Regardless of the actual implementation, changing release versioning every other week breaks _all_ distribution efforts. RPM and DEB need upgradeable versions, here's how RPM does it:

https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Archive:Tools/RPM/VersionComparison

Everything that violates this is not upgradeable on Fedora, openSUSE and co. This means we have to invent artificial versions to have upgradeable packages again.

The last time this happens was when all the clients moved away from 20XX.Y to X.Y.Z. That was pain enough."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-01-18 15:17:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Sascha: what Monty proposes actually does not change release versioning at all. We'd still use "2013.1", "2013.2"... for *releases*. This proposed change only affects random commit artifacts, when someone runs "pythonsetup.py sdist" to build their own tarball.

What MAY change in the future is for *milestones*, which currently are "2013.1~g2" and could become "2013.1.a2" instead. This change would actually make it easier for RPM-based distros ?

Looks like we should really have this discussion on the ML.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-01-18 18:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-18 18:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/19957/2/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/469 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19957/2/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/654 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19957/2/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pyflakes/424 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19957/2/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/654 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19957/2/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/654 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-01-18 21:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Probably the best trade-off. Also not sure we'll use "b" for grizzly-3 (we have until "r" to switch to "b" IIUC.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-01-18 21:50:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-18 21:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-01-21 14:16:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-21 21:58:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

So, glance looks like e.g. glance-2012.3.1.a19.g43f8697

Seems fine to me'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-21 23:44:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

[{'created': '2013-01-17 18:00:05.000000000', 'message': "Just use the git sha for the per-commit case.

In discussions with ttx and zul, it became clear that the git describe info
for our intra-release case wasn't providing any value and was providing
confusion. To simplify things all the way, just make the tarball produced
from a given commit be equal to the version.

Change-Id: I6f0fe029d225afa8f435bc83216fc144c2402ae0
"}, {'created': '2013-01-18 18:51:16.000000000', 'message': "Use revno and git sha for pre-release versioning.

In discussions with ttx and zul, it became clear that the git describe info
for our intra-release case wasn't providing any value and was providing
confusion. Additionally, plain git sha's are not providing enough info.

So, the scheme settled on that breaks the least amount of things and yet
still reduces complexity is:

if pre-version: # server projects
  try:
    use current tag
  except:
    use pre-version+revcount+gitsha
else:
  use git describe | s/-/./

Additionally, we'll use a as a prefix for the revcount, b as the prefix for
the milestone portion of a milestone tag, and rc as the prefix for rc's, so
that for our releases, python version sorting works as expected.

Change-Id: I6f0fe029d225afa8f435bc83216fc144c2402ae0
"}, {'created': '2013-01-18 21:50:28.000000000', 'message': "Use revno and git sha for pre-release versioning.

In discussions with ttx and zul, it became clear that the git describe info
for our intra-release case wasn't providing any value and was providing

if pre-version: # server projects

else:
  use git describe | s/-/./

Additionally, we'll use a as a prefix for the revcount, b as the prefix for
the milestone portion of a milestone tag, and rc as the prefix for rc's, so
that for our releases, python version sorting works as expected.

Change-Id: I6f0fe029d225afa8f435bc83216fc144c2402ae0
"}]
commit_message:
Use revno and git sha for pre-release versioning.

In discussions with ttx and zul, it became clear that the git describe info
for our intra-release case wasn't providing any value and was providing
confusion. Additionally, plain git sha's are not providing enough info.

So, the scheme settled on that breaks the least amount of things and yet
still reduces complexity is:

if pre-version: # server projects
  try:
    use current tag
  except:
    use pre-version+revcount+gitsha
else:
  use git describe | s/-/./

Additionally, we'll use a as a prefix for the revcount, b as the prefix for
the milestone portion of a milestone tag, and rc as the prefix for rc's, so
that for our releases, python version sorting works as expected.

Change-Id: I6f0fe029d225afa8f435bc83216fc144c2402ae0

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-14 11:39:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/19615/1/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/85 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19615/1/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/1211 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19615/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/1211 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/19615/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python26-folsom/418 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19615/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python27-folsom/418 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-01-15 16:15:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

This seems to drift a bit from the specification at http://wiki.openstack.org/Ceilometer/blueprints/APIv2. Could you update and amend the blueprint with the decision and paths taken here?

Correct me if I'm wrong, but it seems that the statistics (avg, sum...) are all computed as long as you request /statistics. Any reason for dropping the c= parameter?

Otherwise, I like it! :)"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-01-15 16:16:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-15 16:21:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We dropped the c= argument to statistics because WSME wants the return type to always be the same and it turned out to be just as easy (or easier) to calculate everything and return it as to figure out which values to calc and return.

There may be other drift, but I think most of it is in the form of "not yet done" things rather than actual changes. We need to do that analysis to make sure, though.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-15 16:57:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(2 inline comments)

Only +1 since I worked with Angus on this. I'll leave it to others to do the final approval after the docstring is fixed."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-01-15 23:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

I have updated the wiki somewhat so it's more obvious that I
have changed:
c[]={sum,max,avg,sum}
to
/meter/<meter>/statistics

So what is not implemented (so far):
1) &Period=
In the bp there was some doubt about the usefulness and ability of implementing this "nicely". - So if it looks
useful I'll add the feature.

2) &s[]=fieldname
Honestly forgot about this one - oops.

But, it would be good to get some "hey I like that feature, please implement". ATM not sure if anyone would use it.

I'll post with the comments sofar.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-14 11:21:41.000000000', 'message': "Flatten the v2 API

This is a squashed commit of work done by Doug and myself.
Thanks Doug!

Author: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>

    Add a Statistics class
    Note this is a bit different to the spec
    (http://wiki.openstack.org/Ceilometer/blueprints/APIv2)
    As wsme doen't really like different types been returned from
    the same method.

    I have:
    GET /v2/meters/<meter> - raw samples
    GET /v2/meters/<meter>/statistics - for the stats

    Make the error reporting better for invalid fields
    Try and protect from passing in the wrong arguments into the db api
    Also get_resources() takes start/stop_timestamp not start/stop.
    Fix most of the duration test cases (overlapping ones are still broken)
    Add some log messages to warn of unimplemented queries
    Fix the start/end timestamp passed into calc_duration()
    Make the query op default to 'eq'
    Fix v2 event list paths
    Remove v2 list projects tests
    Re-Add the duration
    Implement get_meter_statistics() for sqlalchemy.
    Add tests for get_meter_statistics()

Author: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
    fixme comment
    Fix duration calculation
    fix event listing tests
    remove obsolete list tests
    update resource listing tests
    remove obsolete list tests
    fix max statistics tests for projects
    fix max tests for resource queries
    fix tests for stats using project filter
    Fix sum tests for resource queries
    Fix the statistics calculation in the mongo driver to handle getting
    no data back from the query.
    Update the queries in the test code.
    enable logging for wsme in the tests to help with debugging
    always include all query fields to keep values aligned
    only include the start and end timestamp keywords wanted by the EventFilter
    update url used in acl tests
    update tests for listing meters
    convert prints to logging calls and add a few todo/fixme notes
    add some debugging and error checking to _query_to_kwargs
    add q argument to get_json() to make it easier to pass queries to the service
    do not stub out controller we have deleted
    fix whitespace issues to make pep8 happy

Change-Id: I1b9a4c26fb8cc74ae1a002f93b84db05d0b20192
Ref: http://wiki.openstack.org/Ceilometer/blueprints/APIv2
Blueprint: api-aggregate-average
Blueprint: api-server-pecan-wsme

commit_message:
Flatten the v2 API

This is a squashed commit of work done by Doug and myself.
Thanks Doug!

Author: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@redhat.com>

    Add a Statistics class
    Note this is a bit different to the spec
    (http://wiki.openstack.org/Ceilometer/blueprints/APIv2)
    As wsme doen't really like different types been returned from
    the same method.

    I have:
    GET /v2/meters/<meter> - raw samples
    GET /v2/meters/<meter>/statistics - for the stats

    Make the error reporting better for invalid fields
    Try and protect from passing in the wrong arguments into the db api
    Also get_resources() takes start/stop_timestamp not start/stop.
    Fix most of the duration test cases (overlapping ones are still broken)
    Add some log messages to warn of unimplemented queries
    Fix the start/end timestamp passed into calc_duration()
    Make the query op default to 'eq'
    Fix v2 event list paths
    Remove v2 list projects tests
    Re-Add the duration
    Implement get_meter_statistics() for sqlalchemy.
    Add tests for get_meter_statistics()
    Fix the latest pep8 1.4 issues

Author: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
    fixme comment
    Fix duration calculation
    fix event listing tests
    remove obsolete list tests
    update resource listing tests
    remove obsolete list tests
    fix max statistics tests for projects
    fix max tests for resource queries
    fix tests for stats using project filter
    Fix sum tests for resource queries
    Fix the statistics calculation in the mongo driver to handle getting
    no data back from the query.
    Update the queries in the test code.
    enable logging for wsme in the tests to help with debugging
    always include all query fields to keep values aligned
    only include the start and end timestamp keywords wanted by the EventFilter
    update url used in acl tests
    update tests for listing meters
    convert prints to logging calls and add a few todo/fixme notes
    add some debugging and error checking to _query_to_kwargs
    add q argument to get_json() to make it easier to pass queries to the service
    do not stub out controller we have deleted
    fix whitespace issues to make pep8 happy

Change-Id: I1b9a4c26fb8cc74ae1a002f93b84db05d0b20192
Blueprint: api-aggregate-average
Blueprint: api-server-pecan-wsme

commit_message:
Add API V3

This patch adds api-v3 to nova but also keep api-v2 in a tree (and available
in /v2 requests) so the api-v3 is open and systems that depended from v2 will
work fine.

Change-Id: I6987f5aca0b975045000d8c3e1f8052ea16913c6

commit_message:
Add support to nova api-v2 deprecated extension list

This list will be used by nova api-v2 as soon as it becomes deprecated.
Related to bp nova-v3-api

Change-Id: I6ea724d73e40cfe58b90001e248d6ace983dfb54

Please use nova.virt.libvirt.utils.copy_image()
as that should be much more efficient.
It might be best to move it to nova.utils()
as this function is not specific to virt drivers."}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-01-10 18:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The problem with nova.virt.libvirt.utils.copy_image() is that it takes paths to files which are strings.  The point in the abstraction where this change is being made takes file-like objects.  While we may be able to abstract a path string in some cases I am not certain if this applies globally.

Any advice on how to handle this?'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-01-10 18:59:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-01-10 19:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-01-10 19:34:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Oh I see the copy would have to be done outside the download(), keyed on file://

Also looking at the new config option,
it seems a bit redundant TBH'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-01-10 20:07:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-01-10 20:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-10 20:49:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-01-19 23:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Hey john, have you seen this patch for image uploads? https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17803/

I would love to align the efforts of how we can handle direct uploads/downloads. Esp if we can do something simpler than what you suggested in your blog post for the time being.'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-01-20 17:14:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Alex,

I had not seen that patch previously.  Looking beyond this patch, as a next step I was hoping to make a data transfer module/plugin architecture some what like what you have there.  Each plugin would be in a place to handle the direct optimizations that we are talking about.  I have not yet thought about the upload case, but it makes perfect sense to me to have transfer modules that handle upload and download.  I would really like to work with you on that.

However, I do I think this patch makes sense as it is in the immediate term.'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-01-21 18:46:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Yeah this makes sense for now. I want to make sure that we do get a more maintainable solution once we start getting different schemes in place for upload/download. I have this constant paranoia when it comes to technical debt and never getting around to doing things.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-01-21 22:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (1 inline comment)

One clean-up problem in the test…'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-21 22:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Nice work John!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-21 22:23:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-21 23:05:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-10 17:33:25.000000000', 'message': 'Directly copy a file URL from glance.

That patch allows nova to use shutil to copy a file directly from the
glance store.  For this to work glance needs to enable direct_url
descriptions in the image metadata, and the path used to back glance
must match the path used to back nova instance storage.  This should be
a large performance increase for the cases where both glance and nova
instance storage are backed by a shared file system like gluster or
ceph.

A new option has been added to nova: glance_direct_url_download_schemes
This option is set to a list of schemes that can be directly accessed.
For this first simple patch only file:// is valid, and the
implementation is simple and inline.  In the future it would be better
to make this into propagation modules which are dynamically loaded
according to the scheme.

Change-Id: I041b5524f8a0ea59e89ece0202f0503abf2f9d8e
'}, {'created': '2013-01-10 17:59:52.000000000', 'message': 'Directly copy a file URL from glance.

commit_message:
Directly copy a file URL from glance.

That patch allows nova to use shutil to copy a file directly from the
glance store.  For this to work glance needs to enable direct_url
descriptions in the image metadata.  This is done by setting
show_image_direct_url to True in glance-api.conf.  The path used to back
glance also must match the path used to back nova instance storage.  This
should be a large performance increase for the cases where both glance
and nova instance storage are backed by a shared file system like gluster
or ceph.

A new option has been added to nova: allowed_direct_url_schemes
This option is set to a list of schemes that can be directly accessed.
For this first simple patch only file:// is valid, and the
implementation is simple and inline.  In the future it would be better
to make this into propagation modules which are dynamically loaded
according to the scheme.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint direct-file-copy
Change-Id: I041b5524f8a0ea59e89ece0202f0503abf2f9d8e

commit_message:
Clean up db network db calls for fixed and float

Use a join instead of a subquery for fixed_ip_get_by_floating_address
and floating_ip_get_by_fixed_address. Adds test to verify behavior
is the same.

Change-Id: Iab00142d477308c354777a2c64b6d03a21184585

commit_message:
Remove restoring soft deleted entries part 2

There is no need to reuse deleted entries, because they will be archived after
db-archiving implementation. And restoring soft deleted entries produce some
problem with db-unique-keys implementation. So the best way is to remove it.

instance_type_access_add() method
Remove restoring soft deleted instance_type_access entries

Add missing tests for instance_type_access_add

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: I82ee56b50a8422a4b620f4e58967258bac7c01c6

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix typo in configdrive implementation

libvirt configdrive implementation
references 'instane' instead of 'instance'.
Also, add a test for adding configdrive block device
that would catch such an error

fixes bug 1101352

commit_message:
Remove restoring soft deleted entries part 1

There is no need to reuse deleted entries, because they will be archived after
db-archiving implementation. And restoring soft deleted entries produce some
problem with db-unique-keys implementation. So the best way is to remove it.

instance_type_access_add() method
Remove restoring soft deleted instance_type_access entries

instance_type_extra_specs_update_or_create() method
Remove restoring soft deleted instance_type_extra_specs entries
Add missing transaction

aggregate_host_add() method
Remove restoring soft deleted aggreagate_hosts entries
Add missing transaction

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: Ida7db95233c40faacac55105650f52d42ad360c2

commit_message:
lib/quantum: refactor quantum plugins and third party

As quantum plugin support is coming like floodlight, nvp and nec,
it's worth while to refactor quantum plugin logic so that each plugin can
be modified/enhanced intervening with other quantum plugin.
And new plugin support can be added easily (hopefully) without modifying
core logic.

Change-Id: Ic5ab5b993272fdd3b4e779823323777a845ee681

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-17 17:38:29.000000000', 'message': 'PXE driver should not accept empty kernel UUID.

Baremetal PXE driver was aborting only if the kernel and ramdisk
specified in image metadata were None, but not if they were another
non-true value, such as "". Now, exception is raised if they are any
non-true value.

Fix bug 1100589.

Change-Id: I9783a14cc242e1b9db04d797c61d54b06d52c680
'}]
commit_message:
PXE driver should not accept empty kernel UUID.

Baremetal PXE driver was aborting only if the kernel and ramdisk
specified in image metadata were None, but not if they were another
non-true value, such as "". Now, exception is raised if they are any
non-true value.

Fix bug 1100589.

Change-Id: I9783a14cc242e1b9db04d797c61d54b06d52c680

commit_message:
Test to upload object in segments and download it

Adds test case to "test_object_services.py" so as to  check the
upload segmented objects support into a container and download
those segments into a collected data. And also a method
"create_object_segments" in object_client.py

Change-Id: I798fe73509f7504fc5fe4aa7c7c3e37799cbfe6e
implements: blueprint add-some-functional-swift-tests

the existing get_vnc_console support.

commit_message:
heat engine : make watchrule actions run in stack ThreadGroup

Make watchrule alarm actions run via greenthreads in the stack
ThreadGroup - this allows them to be correctly cancelled if the
stack is deleted whilst an alarm action is in progress.

fixes bug 1097847

Change-Id: I3190a05e3d0abd492961071d2db59a212bd4d373
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat engine : watchrule save state when actions undefined

We should save WatchRule state transitions, even if an action
for that state has not been defined in the template.

Change-Id: Iadca203d03b2c2a2a186a4e9574687d8f30ab080
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
ReST API: Don't overwrite webob error messages

We don't want to replace the entire body of the error messages returned,
just add our detailed description at the end.

Change-Id: I5899854d1ed1766285a5cae2f14c24025ed92e4b
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2013-01-21 17:08:15.000000000', 'message': "Avoid testtools 0.9.25

Fixes bug 1102400

testtools 0.9.25 introduces a new dependency on the 'extras' package, but
it does so in a way to prevents itself from being installed without the
'extras' package already installed.

Work around the problem for now by avoiding the problematic release.

Change-Id: If8aa3925c744fad88f6f2715b5e779d0c258524c
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid testtools 0.9.25

Fixes bug 1102400

testtools 0.9.25 introduces a new dependency on the 'extras' package, but
it does so in a way to prevents itself from being installed without the
'extras' package already installed.

Work around the problem for now by avoiding the problematic release.

Change-Id: If8aa3925c744fad88f6f2715b5e779d0c258524c

commit_message:
heat tests : test_watch remove logging

Remove logging, since it's not configured to go anywhere,
and we don't have logging in any other tests

Change-Id: I50a3e08b0ee65f767e1b7471f1fb9679a4d3271f
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add --run-dir switch to swift-init

- Add ability to specify an alternative run_dir than the default
  /var/run/swift.
- DocImpact

Change-Id: I17677588f2c8da563b7fec2dc4fdc52da87126ed

commit_message:
Refactor compute_utils to avoid db lookup

This simple change passes bdms into the following compute_utils function
to avoid it doing a database lookup:

  get_device_name_for_instance()

Related to bp/no-db-compute

Change-Id: I1475b184d8e88b700d606aaf77cc7cd21e83efbb

commit_message:
Enforces generic sqlalchemy types in migrations.

Fixes bug 1102491

Modifies the service_type migration to use sqlalchemy types instead of
mysql types. Also removes the import of mysql from several of the
migrations.

Change-Id: I0495a711cd14f64ced4d32857e30586a42b83839

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-21 16:06:25.000000000', 'message': 'ReST API: Return 400 for malformed JSON input

Previously we had an unhandled exception that resulted in a 500 (Internal
Server Error) result and a stack trace when an invalid JSON file was
submitted in a POST/PUT request. Change to catching the exception and
returning a 400 (Bad Request) result.

bug 1102391

Change-Id: I7dde33ae732d9addbf988b1d36d4f06eacb634bf
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
ReST API: Return 400 for malformed JSON input

Previously we had an unhandled exception that resulted in a 500 (Internal
Server Error) result and a stack trace when an invalid JSON file was
submitted in a POST/PUT request. Change to catching the exception and
returning a 400 (Bad Request) result.

bug 1102391

Change-Id: I7dde33ae732d9addbf988b1d36d4f06eacb634bf
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

'}, {'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-01-15 08:39:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I found one interesting thing. Task log entries are never deleted softly. So there is no need in bp/db-unique-keys implantation to avoid race condition in task_log_begin_task() method. We could just add unique constraint to fields 

  (task_name', 'period_beggining', 'period_ending', 'host')

And then we could just use NovaBase.save() method and it will raise DBDuplicateEntry exception if such task already exists.

But there is a problem. Unique constraints have max size limit. In mysql (about 250 chars) And host is String(255), state is String(255).. 

Probably we should create one more field with hash of these 4 fields and add UC on it."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-01-17 13:58:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

It is used to remove from task_log_get() and task_log_get_all() session.
parametr and save performance.

task_log_get() method
Remove session parameter from public method.

task_log_get_all() method
Remove session parameter from public method.

task_log_begin_task()
Remove session parameter from public method.
Remove unused return value.

task_log_end_task()
Remove session parameter from public method.
Use 1 db request instead of 2.
Remove unused return value.

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: I2c8252de7978e8fddd800e903f18a73ee9a95034
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor work with TaskLog in sqlalchemy.api

Add _task_log_get_query() private method
It is used to remove from task_log_get() and task_log_get_all() session.
parametr and save performance.

task_log_get() method
Remove session parameter from public method.

task_log_get_all() method
Remove session parameter from public method.

task_log_begin_task()
Remove session parameter from public method.
Remove unused return value.

task_log_end_task()
Remove session parameter from public method.
Use 1 db request instead of 2.
Remove unused return value.

blueprint db-session-cleanup

Change-Id: I2c8252de7978e8fddd800e903f18a73ee9a95034

[{'created': '2013-01-21 16:25:57.000000000', 'message': "Avoid testtools 0.9.25

Fixes bug 1102400

testtools 0.9.25 introduces a new dependency on the 'extras' package, but
it does so in a way to prevents itself from being installed without the
'extras' package already installed.

Work around the problem for now by avoiding the problematic release.

Change-Id: Ib42ffc67f00db62f9b829069c00476632daae94f
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid testtools 0.9.25

Fixes bug 1102400

testtools 0.9.25 introduces a new dependency on the 'extras' package, but
it does so in a way to prevents itself from being installed without the
'extras' package already installed.

Work around the problem for now by avoiding the problematic release.

Change-Id: Ib42ffc67f00db62f9b829069c00476632daae94f

I think p-draigbrady's comment is valid.  In general, a backport should fix a user visible problem, but I don't see one linked.

Not sure if that is the case with this one."}, {'account_id': 704, 'date': '2013-01-21 16:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Agree with Pádraig and Dan - this doesn't seem to meet the "safe, high-impact, user-visible fix" criteria

If there are cases where 500 is returned instead of 4xx, we should list the specific cases in a bug report where this can be reproduced and consider how to fix those without such a widespread, risky looking change'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-21 16:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi,
Please look at bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1086226 for an example. In addition to this please look at the comments from the bug review in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/18647/1/quantum/api/v2/base.py.
Over the course of grizzly we have had at least 4 bugs which involved incorrect return codes from the Quantum service.
I think that this is very important to get into the stable branch. 
Is it just the commit message - or do we need a bug ID. 
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-01-21 16:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2013-01-21 16:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Exceptions cleanup

Ensure that the quantum exceptions in FAULT_MAP are grouped
together (this will save endless bug fixes when the server
will return 500 instead of 4xx)

Change-Id: I89581e1b6b4af3eb1803d6226686adf0b576d1e7

commit_message:
Added doc support for Floating API extension

This adds doc support for action "removeFloatingIp".
(Support for "addFloatingIp" was added on a previous change, but corrected the URI this time)
New sample files:   src/wadls/compute-api/src/api_samples/os-floating-ips/floating-ips-remove-req.json
                    src/wadls/compute-api/src/api_samples/os-floating-ips/floating-ips-remove-req.xml
Modified: src/wadls/compute-api/src/ext/os-floating-ips.wadl
Needed to add a new resource id, since modifying the existing one would affect other two methods.
This matches now: https://answers.launchpad.net/nova/+question/210126
Fixes: bug 1073763

Change-Id: I7515b94800924731f5c103611e56e4ef6f127c6f

commit_message:
change ipv6 format to pass on postgresql

postgresql recently moved to storing ip addresses as native types.
The problem being that we send down some slightly unnatural looking
IPv6 strings, so when we return them our simple comparitors fail.

Converting this to a more IPv6 natural definition makes it pass with
postgresql.

Fixes bug #1101645

Change-Id: I282eb7e873d824e7c03923c2200bbe1e2d0bbada

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-18 12:21:12.000000000', 'message': 'Don't catch GreenletExit with "except Exception:"

GreenletExit is, both by name and definition, an exit exception. The
Exception class is the "Common base class for all non-exit exceptions",
however GreenletExit is implemented as a subclass of Exception.  We do
not wish to catch exit exceptions in "except Exception:" clauses, so
monkey-patch GreenletExit to inherit directly from BaseException as it
should.

bug 1097203

Change-Id: Ia91efcbe69d9162140a9fb2994ec947f71b2f652
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Don't catch GreenletExit with "except Exception:"

GreenletExit is, both by name and definition, an exit exception. The
Exception class is the "Common base class for all non-exit exceptions",
however GreenletExit is implemented as a subclass of Exception.  We do
not wish to catch exit exceptions in "except Exception:" clauses, so
monkey-patch GreenletExit to inherit directly from BaseException as it
should.

bug 1097203

Change-Id: Ia91efcbe69d9162140a9fb2994ec947f71b2f652
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

subject: Clarify the ambiguity of the "more actions" dropdown.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1816, 'name': 'Gabriel Hurley', 'email': 'gabriel.hurley@nebula.com', 'username': 'gabriel-hurley'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 2069, 'name': 'Yufang Zhang', 'email': 'yufang521247@gmail.com', 'username': 'yufang521247'}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}, {'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 4978, 'name': 'Julie Pichon', 'email': 'jpichon@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpichon'}, {'_account_id': 5400, 'name': 'Yanping Xie', 'email': 'irsxyp@gmail.com', 'username': 'irsxyp'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-07 11:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/19082/1/check/gate-horizon-docs/841 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19082/1/check/gate-horizon-pep8/1931 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/19082/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/24638 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19082/1/check/gate-devstack-vm-quantum/1197 : FAILURE (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 2069, 'date': '2013-01-07 11:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-01-10 14:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Yanping, thank you for the patch!

I agree that this patch does what it sets out to do, however I wonder if it is really necessary? I find the interface feels more cluttered with the term "Actions" repeated every line over and over, especially when it's also the name of the column header.

Could you provide more details on the confusion and problems caused by the current display? Do people miss that there are additional options? Do they accidentally click on the first action? Where is the ambiguity?

So far, with the plural "Actions" column header and the arrow image beside the first action name, I haven't been aware of problems, but perhaps it's easier to miss the additional options in languages with no plural form for nouns. I'm hoping though, that we can find a way to mitigate the problem that is less text-heavy.

Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 5400, 'date': '2013-01-11 03:31:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Julie,

Thank you for your review. 

This patch was first motivated when I did a demo of horizon for users. They asked where to reboot instances in horizon. Of course they would find the right action options after they playing a while with horizon, but it would be better if we could make the UI more directly, I think. Also they did click on the first action by accident.

Another concern about this issue is that when there are many instances with different status displayed on the table, the action column would looks cluttered, even worse when the buttons txt are translated into local language such as Chinese.  So a default 'action' button would be more clear.

Looking forward for your opinion."}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-01-11 07:48:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thank you for your contribution.
From the code, your change looks sane.

I do understand your reasoning, but I disagree here. I'd just add text, when it's really necessary."}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-01-11 16:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Yanping, thank you for the reply. You make a good point about the different statuses. I'm not an expert in UIs so I asked an in-house interaction designer for her thoughts on having an "Actions" label on every line. Overall, she seems to think that it would be a bit better than the current implementation.

PROS:
1) When the button is shown as (for example) "Edit v" this might feel a bit odd to a user since they are being asked to drop down an item that reads "Edit" to find more items that aren't related to Editing necessarily. If this is labeled "Actions", then all of the items below are Actions to perform on this instance and it feels a bit more sound.
2) Users tend to notice when things don't match... but if all of the actions read "Edit Instance" and one is "Delete Instance" this might cause some concern from users. It would at least make them pause and analyze visually what is going on. This is actually a useful tactic in some cases where you want to make an error case stick out in a graph, but I think in this case we don't want their eyes to jump around while looking at this page.

CONS:
1) This adds an extra click if the user wants to choose the first action. I'm not sure how often these actions are used, so I can't comment on how much this might affect the main use cases, but I wouldn't be too concerned over this right now.
2) Users might find it very repetitive at first, but from what I have seen in the past, after using it for a week they won't really even notice that it's there anymore. They are just trained to click and choose an action.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-01-15 19:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-01-15 20:01:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I've uploaded an alternate approach which I think meets a happier middle-ground. It preserves the intended behavior of having a "primary action" which is always available with one click while adding the word "more" to clarify what happens when clicking the dropdown toggle. I believe this is more in the spirit of the original UX designs.

Incidentally it also kills all the hacks for differing ation column widths and just turns off line wrapping altogether for the contents of that cell.

Feedback is welcome.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-15 20:49:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/19082/2/check/gate-horizon-docs/883 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19082/2/check/gate-horizon-pep8/1973 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19082/2/check/gate-horizon-python26/1230 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19082/2/check/gate-horizon-python27/1239 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19082/2/check/gate-horizon-selenium/748 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19082/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/26853 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19082/2/check/gate-devstack-vm-quantum/3726 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2013-01-18 16:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I wish there were a textless way of clarifying the ambiguity, but I can't think of anything else. The "happier middle-ground" approach looks and works well, thank you.

One concern would be how well this will translate to other languages, if "More" is not expressed in a form as conveniently short than in English.'}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2013-01-19 02:11:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Matthias here. The intention is good, however I believe the arrow is clear and intuitive for most users and they would feel the text just clutters the UI."}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-01-20 23:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@lin-hua: I believe Matthias' comment was on the original patch removing the default action entirely and putting all actions under an "actions" dropdown, quite different from the current proposal which simply adds the word "more".

While I do agree that adding the extra word adds a little visual clutter, the ambiguity of the dropdown arrow has been identified in several design research sessions both at Nebula and by other groups as being confusing to users. There's a definite issue that needs to be solved, the problem has simply been finding a reasonable compromise solution, which I personally think this meets.

I would certainly like to hear more opinions on the matter, however.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-21 08:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-01-21 08:22:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

This looks better. In general, I'm undecided. Loading more text in a pretty stuffed UI make the situation not better. But also, removing text doesn't remove ambiguity. So, this is probably the way to go."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-21 08:54:45.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-21 08:54:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-07 11:21:09.000000000', 'message': "Refactor dropdown arrow button.

Fixes bug 1096835.

In instance or image table, the dropdown arrow button displays the
first available action by default, which is ambiguous for users.
This patch refactors dropdown arrow button more explicit by adding
an 'Actions' button as the default one.

Change-Id: I74c03a9cd0655457f85332c9c7d31ef3ae15059e
"}, {'created': '2013-01-15 19:59:14.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify the ambiguity of the "more actions" dropdown.

Adds the word "More" to the dropdown toggle to clearly indicate
what the arrow is for. Also disables line-wrapping between the
primary action and its dropdown toggle. Removes the individual
hacks for the widths of various tables.

Change-Id: I74c03a9cd0655457f85332c9c7d31ef3ae15059e
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify the ambiguity of the "more actions" dropdown.

Adds the word "More" to the dropdown toggle to clearly indicate
what the arrow is for. Also disables line-wrapping between the
primary action and its dropdown toggle. Removes the individual
hacks for the widths of various tables.

Change-Id: I74c03a9cd0655457f85332c9c7d31ef3ae15059e

commit_message:
Ensure that Quantum uses configured fixed IP

Fixes bug 1094897

The fix ensures that the fixed IP address specified by the user
is correctly passed to Quantum. That is, when the Quantum port
is created it is created with the specified IP address.

Change-Id: I8191ac2497037e2592b0679962e4606cd24d7844

commit_message:
Catch another breakage, when cinder is unavailable

During review of backporting avoid cinder calls, this
has been discovered and should be applied to master branch.

Fixes bug 1098146

Well, we like to avoid a runtime dependency on nodejs (openSUSE), so we compress offline during the package build phase. however, without this fix, django_compressor parses the django templates differently, i.e. it is missing HORIZON_CONFIG and thus generates different compressed css/js files. And that makes a cache miss at runtime. 

A template example is horizon/templates/horizon/_conf.html, the generated (compressed) javascript depends on HORIZON_CONFIG being available or not'}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2013-01-19 02:24:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Extend offline-compression context

When using offline compression, all context information needs to be
available in order to generate matching compressor output.

Change I84807f6ca0d9769d25b942c151c1a83501648a0a introduced references
to HORIZON_CONFIG, so add it to the predefined list of context for
offline compression as well.

Change-Id: I44ee139626f0eac6fa34f9136926a1a626498039

commit_message:
Remove |safe from openrc.template

Review I56ec047da467b721bd1b57d2c97d05717e83f468 added |safe to
the TEMPLATE_NAME variable in order to allow special characters for
tenant names but it turned out to be a security issue as explained in
one of the comments.

This reverts commit 3a9b0da489030eaacc6cc0416f92192b74783ac8

It's still an issue to discuss as referenced in bug 1100042

Change-Id: I919a56ac799e3358bf3d56af3c6083814e97c98d

commit_message:
Allow insecure authentication

Pass through the value of OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY from settings.py to
keystoneclient. This allows connecting to servers with self-signed
or otherwise invalid certificates for testing purposes.

Bug #1100131

Change-Id: I281fae400c1311af32e279083f51fba95e0e326c

commit_message:
Improves some UX details

Adds underline style to sortable column headers
in tables with more than one item.

Changes 'Click here to show only VNC' string
with 'Show only VNC' and adds underline style.

Substitute 'Unpause' with 'Resume' in Instances dropdown and
'Unpausing' with 'Resuming' in Task column on update.

Change-Id: I903722191d9c511b9961a666d0e644dbf87111b5
Fixes: Adds usability improvements
Bug: #1100418

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-18 16:53:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix attributes processing in ActionMetaclass

ActionMetaclass.__new__() creates a class object twice. At first,
it uses DeclarativeFieldsMetaclass.__new__() only to get a side effect
of gathering form fields to base_fields, and then it uses type.__new__()
to create the resulting class object. Dropping the first created class
object results in ignoring all that DeclarativeFieldsMetaclass.__new__()
does with it (currently, it adds a 'media' attribute).

This change uses the class object returned by
DeclarativeFieldsMetaclass.__new__() adding Meta options to it,
thereby fixing the issue.

Change-Id: Ia4ee0e7187846ea13c04505cbbe7b999c2044871
"}]
commit_message:
Fix attributes processing in ActionMetaclass

ActionMetaclass.__new__() creates a class object twice. At first,
it uses DeclarativeFieldsMetaclass.__new__() only to get a side effect
of gathering form fields to base_fields, and then it uses type.__new__()
to create the resulting class object. Dropping the first created class
object results in ignoring all that DeclarativeFieldsMetaclass.__new__()
does with it (currently, it adds a 'media' attribute).

This change uses the class object returned by
DeclarativeFieldsMetaclass.__new__() adding Meta options to it,
thereby fixing the issue.

Change-Id: Ia4ee0e7187846ea13c04505cbbe7b999c2044871

commit_message:
Absolute limits of -1 should be treated as unlimited

-1 were interpreted literally, causing quota-related calculations to
show as overquota instead of unlimited

Fixes bug #1098480

Change-Id: I52377c690c5169f63624959711fce7566d59f9af

[{'created': '2013-01-20 22:46:39.000000000', 'message': "Disable Apt Recommends.

This disables apt's default behaviour of installing packages in the
Recommends field of other packages. While this can be useful, it
causes a lot of unnecessary software to be installed and may cause
explicit dependencies to be missed in some circumstances.

Change-Id: I10f4519290e6b3dafda3365c0c5dcc42ad17c090
"}]
commit_message:
Disable Apt Recommends.

This disables apt's default behaviour of installing packages in the
Recommends field of other packages. While this can be useful, it
causes a lot of unnecessary software to be installed and may cause
explicit dependencies to be missed in some circumstances.

Change-Id: I10f4519290e6b3dafda3365c0c5dcc42ad17c090

This adds a missing method required for creating sheepdog volumes.

Change-Id: Id157df5c4d69148257060926dbac7b5bc2804ee0
Fixes: bug #1100655.
'}, {'created': '2013-01-19 03:31:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix sheepdog volume creation

SheepdogDriver uses an undefined method _sizestr.  This patch removes
it.

Change-Id: Id157df5c4d69148257060926dbac7b5bc2804ee0
Fixes: bug #1100655.
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sheepdog volume creation

SheepdogDriver uses an undefined method _sizestr.  This patch removes
it.

Change-Id: Id157df5c4d69148257060926dbac7b5bc2804ee0
Fixes: bug #1100655.

commit_message:
Support Tempest config file format transition

* Identity server location just configure by an URI
* Image service location resolved by service endpoint
* Credentials will be defined only in the identity section
* Whitebox gets it's own section
* ssh username is per image option

Change-Id: I3b0d51a323560451c5636363896cadb39e0ea2d6

commit_message:
Enable nova Verbose logging

With oslo-incubator commit 751c35b1c8ff0730883a8ccdda9b77a49fff2405,
(Change-Id: Ic9e3cb5979b2d7283552ad3a461870373f45a239)

commit_message:
Remove network_host config option

It appears to be unused since 9c0ffe7 and was related to the
stub_network option which itself was removed in 3313cff.

Change-Id: Ic555e3523a90c83c6a89f24619252099c4e55f37

commit_message:
Fix multi line docstring tests in hacking.py

* Fixes N403, along with docstring test
* Adds N404, multi line start
* Disable N403 and N404 until all cases are fixed
* Remove obsolote '--repeat' flag from tox.ini

Change-Id: Ibf6371efc1cdc764e66f6f7c5c4362440101f963

commit_message:
Allow nova to use insecure cinderclient.

Add an option cinder_api_insecure to pass on to cinderclient.

Bug 1100459

Change-Id: Ifb31cc0df48d2345fa0a6ec440bdf9685254cbcd

commit_message:
Remove obsolete baremetal override of MAC addresses.

Now that the hypervisor driver can specify what MAC addresses it
needs, overriding the MAC address during bare metal instance
provisioning is no longer appropriate.

Change-Id: I2b0790753297104ddd40a410c8acb5fdac97ad15

When we delete an instance which is resizing from m1.small to m1.tiny, we use
instance['memory_mb'] to create quota's ram reservation, if the resizing is not
'finished', the in_use value in quota_usages is NOT commited(2048M),
but the instance['memory_mb'] is updated(512M) in _finish_resize(), so the
deleting operation after updating will commit a wrong ram reservation(-512M),
and the in_use value changes to 2048-512=1536.
The cores reservation encounters the same problem.

Fixes bug #1099729

Change-Id: Ide54fc9d822041f535819c496822aeac5a8dc68d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong quota reservation when deleting resizing instance

When we delete an instance which is resizing from m1.small to m1.tiny, we use
instance['memory_mb'] to create quota's ram reservation, if the resizing is not
'finished', the in_use value in quota_usages is NOT commited(2048M),
but the instance['memory_mb'] is updated(512M) in _finish_resize(), so the
deleting operation after updating will commit a wrong ram reservation(-512M),
and the in_use value changes to 2048-512=1536.
The cores reservation encounters the same problem.

Fixes bug #1099729

Change-Id: Ide54fc9d822041f535819c496822aeac5a8dc68d

commit_message:
lib/cinder: add sheepdog support

This enables us to use Sheepdog as a Cinder backend storage by setting
the CINDER_DRIVER environment variable.

Change-Id: I70cfb7f89ac3260d277fa160c457d220255de065

[{'created': '2013-01-17 14:39:00.000000000', 'message': "Add support for setting up nova-spicehtml5proxy

Add a new service 'n-spice' which is off by default, but can
be enabled to turn on SPICE support in the Nova libvirt driver.
Also if neither n-novnc or n-xvnc are enabled, then disable
VNC support. This allows running in a SPICE only environment.

The spice-html5 repo will be checked out to support the Horizon
client integration

Change-Id: If74fad33a7b491450afd823758d35b06ebe72cb9
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for setting up nova-spicehtml5proxy

Add a new service 'n-spice' which is off by default, but can
be enabled to turn on SPICE support in the Nova libvirt driver.
Also if neither n-novnc or n-xvnc are enabled, then disable
VNC support. This allows running in a SPICE only environment.

The spice-html5 repo will be checked out to support the Horizon
client integration

Change-Id: If74fad33a7b491450afd823758d35b06ebe72cb9
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Run nova-novncproxy binary in the nova GIT trree

The nova-novncproxy binary was pulled into the nova GIT tree
several months back, so devstack should run that version,
rather than the legacy version from the noVNC GIT tree.

Change-Id: I289989d5c0831c75117f059dd8f2decb1f9d3a90
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add optional force option to openstack api delete

The volume api allows force to skip check of volume status
on delete, but we weren't exposing it via the external API.

This change just adds the option of taking in the force
argument in V1 and V2 API's and allows us to now call
force from the cinderclient.

Change-Id: Iaba3590220427096499af3b77116822c62212992

commit_message:
Add --force option to delete method.

The cinder volume:api allows force option on volume delete,
which ignores the status of the volume when requesting a delete.

This change adds the ability to use that option from the cinderclient.
There's one missing piece in cinder/api/v1/volumes that needs added for this to
work and is added in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19981/

Change-Id: Ib512081904e09f27698af5ef75d19a63d2d45638

commit_message:
Use conductor in the servicegroup db driver.

This patch updates the servicegroup db driver to use the conductor API
in the cases where it was accessing the db directly before.  If the
service is allowed to do direct db access, the conductor API will
optimize the call to go straight to the db.  Otherwise, it will invoke
rpc to a remove conductor service to perform the operations.

Part of bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I96adffc6f80288c829d84f170414613a35b5c840

commit_message:
Add service_update to conductor.

Add a service_update method to the conductor API.  This will be
necessary for removing direct db access from the servicegroup db driver.

Part of bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: Ic9a205ed4e810ee3511378742f764b2b311174a7

commit_message:
Remove some db calls from db servicegroup driver.

The base service code already ensures that a service record is created.
Store that in the service object.  Then down in the servicegroup db
driver, access it instead of having to go look it up again.

Part of bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: Ife3c98c29c6f654585e14ded5a9b4c7e3bec226d

This reverts commit 58dec9d45360a69192fc6ba43dddf5a597063972

This ended gating of the XML API without any real public deliberation.  It should be reverted, and a plan agreed upon with PTLs and the CI team.

Also, if we do decide to implement this, we should make the CI change _first_ so that we don't abruptly stop gating on something we should be testing.'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Split up XML and JSON testing."

This reverts commit 58dec9d45360a69192fc6ba43dddf5a597063972

This ended gating of the XML API without any real public deliberation.  It should be reverted, and a plan agreed upon with PTLs and the CI team.

Also, if we do decide to implement this, we should make the CI change _first_ so that we don't abruptly stop gating on something we should be testing.

commit_message:
Using diffrent interval for each pollster

    fix bug 1010037

    Diffrent type of pollster may require diffrent interval to poll data.
    The pipeline management can set the interval by requirement for each
    publisher.

Using diffrent interval for each pollster

fix bug 1010037

Diffrent type of pollster may require diffrent interval to poll data.
The pipeline management can set the interval by requirement for each
publisher.

commit_message:
change keystone rolename to Member, from memberRole

fixes bug 1101340

As noted in the bug report, Horizon expects Member as a role,
though the docs were using memberRole, causing bugs to be
encountered.

Change-Id: I27c29c829dc2bea0c9bb80a2e101a15a4553c2c7

[{'created': '2013-01-18 22:42:45.000000000', 'message': 'Create redstack command for post devstack run

Created a new command called post-devstack, which is meant to be run after a reddwarf devstack install.
The new redstack task does the following:
1. Create extra test users needed for the integration tests (eg. daffy, chunk, etc.)
2. Modify the integration test config files.
3. Install the needed test packages (proboscis/nose)
4. Build the guestimage and upload it to glance

Also fixed the path of the reddwarf conf files to be /etc/reddwarf and not ~.
(To be consistent with other OS components)

Fixes bug 1101297, 1101296

Change-Id: I352d0e50c4af5c7a131eae2b2a21b55cd1d52e7b
'}]
commit_message:
Create redstack command for post devstack run

Created a new command called post-devstack, which is meant to be run after a reddwarf devstack install.
The new redstack task does the following:
1. Create extra test users needed for the integration tests (eg. daffy, chunk, etc.)
2. Modify the integration test config files.
3. Install the needed test packages (proboscis/nose)
4. Build the guestimage and upload it to glance

Also fixed the path of the reddwarf conf files to be /etc/reddwarf and not ~.
(To be consistent with other OS components)

Fixes bug 1101297, 1101296

Change-Id: I352d0e50c4af5c7a131eae2b2a21b55cd1d52e7b

'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-01-17 22:02:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi,

I do most of my work on master, rather than the stable branch. In addition, we have a kinda rule that patches to go into stable branches should be backported from master, rather than going into the stable branch first.

So, IMO, this change of default breaks both my personal workflow, and the workflow we expect people to follow

Am I missing something?"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-01-17 22:06:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Tom:

Alan's proposed change is only to the .gitreview file in the stable/folsom branch. The .gitreview file in the master branch is unchanged.

The end result is that if you do "git review" in a branch that was created from master, it will still go to master, but if you do "git review" from a branch that was created from "stable/folsom", it will go to stable/folsom. Seems like a good idea to me.'}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2013-01-17 22:22:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah, what Lorin said, we use that on stable/* branches in other projects and it works just fine.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-17 23:28:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

We do this for other stable/folsom branches'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-01-18 21:41:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Seems like a good idea to me (and will help me not trip over the merging hiccups I've had)."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-18 22:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-01-18 22:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

ah, I knew I missed something - thanks :)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-18 22:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
Split up XML and JSON testing.

This adds a new boolean config option to compute, 'use_xml'. If
enabled tests will run with XML where applicable. Otherwise the
tests will only run with JSON.

Implements bp split-xml-json-tests

Change-Id: I139dac23194b3abdf26a0d3622461942478facb5

commit_message:
Add testr and testr_coverage comands.

We have a couple of chunks of shell that are repeated in all of the
tox.ini files for the projects that are using testr. Not only is it repeated,
but the use of shell in the tox.ini file causes tox itself to print a warning
which is distracting. Encapsulate that into setup.py commands so that:
 a) it's run via python in the venv, silencing tox warning
 b) we don't have to copy the code all over the place

Change-Id: I637156d26a1d63e960939a2818f45ea88042e9b6

commit_message:
Checks guest status during migration.

During a migration, waits for the guest and service to start up
following the status change to VERIFY_RESIZE. Confirms if everything
is all right, or reverts if not.

Implements blueprint migration-check-guest-status

Change-Id: Ia7c7ed1fd0070429fed93323ca559d1c0742bd8f

commit_message:
Test to check temp url support

Adds a test case to test_object_services.py so as to verify the
GET object using temp url.And also a method to GET object
using the temp url in object_client.py

Change-Id: I929ffabf8a1344f21c8acc492f8c4e31966556fd

A logic error in volume exercise's wait for volume deletion
causes the test to do the opopsite, and continue on even tho
the volume is in in the 'deleting' state.  If using a volume
backend that can quickly delete volumes (ceph), and the volume
is gone before entering the wait, the loop will spin, timeout
and fail the test.

Change-Id: I8e3d2aaa04e6a165e0dee32bedac97d35e13d5eb
(cherry picked from commit 756c842a7743a84a084b4cc211998e3fdd171592)
"}]
commit_message:
Properly wait until volumes are gone in volumes.sh

A logic error in volume exercise's wait for volume deletion
causes the test to do the opopsite, and continue on even tho
the volume is in in the 'deleting' state.  If using a volume
backend that can quickly delete volumes (ceph), and the volume
is gone before entering the wait, the loop will spin, timeout
and fail the test.

Change-Id: I8e3d2aaa04e6a165e0dee32bedac97d35e13d5eb
(cherry picked from commit 756c842a7743a84a084b4cc211998e3fdd171592)

commit_message:
Save password set through xen agent.

The get-password extension expects an encrypted b64 encoded password.
If we are setting the password via a guest agent and the user has
provided a public key, then we can go ahead and encrypt the password
and write it to metadata. If the guest agent is not working or not
installed, we leave the encrypted password to be set by posting to the
metadata server.

Related to blueprint get-password

Change-Id: I3ed26c7e1929f3c4c84f9bb87b0c620ab27223cb

Require greenlet 0.3.2 (or later)

Version 0.3.2 resolves a bug that allowed generic "except Exception:"
clauses to catch GreenletExit exceptions.

bug 1097203

Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-16 21:31:11.000000000', 'message': "Makes sure compute doesn't crash on failed resume.

If the call to the driver to resume an instance raises an exception,
then nova-compute fails to start properly. This can happen during
recovery, for example, where an instance has been deleted so the
backing files are gone but the database is restored to a state
where it exists.

This patch fixes the issue by catching the exception and setting
the instance to error.

Fixes bug 1100430

Change-Id: Ie31f39fcd43174c29bf7a5cb1b6fa29e4c723f97
(cherry picked from commit 3b4016184f83c71158d41db9a26e6043d9ae1506)
"}]
commit_message:
Makes sure compute doesn't crash on failed resume.

If the call to the driver to resume an instance raises an exception,
then nova-compute fails to start properly. This can happen during
recovery, for example, where an instance has been deleted so the
backing files are gone but the database is restored to a state
where it exists.

This patch fixes the issue by catching the exception and setting
the instance to error.

Fixes bug 1100430

Change-Id: Ie31f39fcd43174c29bf7a5cb1b6fa29e4c723f97
(cherry picked from commit 3b4016184f83c71158d41db9a26e6043d9ae1506)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-18 08:20:13.000000000', 'message': 'Cells: Fix for relaying instance info_cache updates

The update_cells argument was ignored in db/api.py.  The API cell when
doing an update calls this with False to prevent relaying the request
back to itself... but it was being relayed anyway.

Change-Id: I5a40c878a547e81605dc40f0077b7c6e20ee3ad4
'}]
commit_message:
Cells: Fix for relaying instance info_cache updates

The update_cells argument was ignored in db/api.py.  The API cell when
doing an update calls this with False to prevent relaying the request
back to itself... but it was being relayed anyway.

Change-Id: I5a40c878a547e81605dc40f0077b7c6e20ee3ad4

    creates sudoers files in tmp and sets perms before moving it to /etc/sudoers.d
    creates .ssh dir as root then changes perms and ownership to guest user
    creates symlinks to elements files rather than copying them to diskimage-builder

Change-Id: Ib019e46107fab1362d57f5fec3cdb97214764614
Fixes: bug/1100507
'}]
commit_message:
Clean up scripts for guest image building

    creates sudoers files in tmp and sets perms before moving it to /etc/sudoers.d
    creates .ssh dir as root then changes perms and ownership to guest user
    creates symlinks to elements files rather than copying them to diskimage-builder

Change-Id: Ib019e46107fab1362d57f5fec3cdb97214764614
Fixes: bug/1100507

commit_message:
don't allow crs in the code

triggered by this slipping into quantum, now that we have more windows
developers we should ensure that \r\n doesn't land in the code as
a line ending. This check prevents it.

Change-Id: I0a82be0e74915d3c3c25203db110d279580c148b

commit_message:
Snapshot support for XenAPINFS

Related to blueprint xenapinfs-snapshots

Add support for snapshots, by implementing it with deep copies. Each
snapshot is a copy of the volume. Snapshot object has a new,
provider_location key, to store volume parameters.

Change-Id: Iea06246319ce82d5fcfe417419156ec83ef0a895

commit_message:
version bump to 1.7.7-dev

I expect the next release to actually be 1.8, but to prevent issues
if we decide to release 1.7.7, I'm only moving the rev number.

Change-Id: Ia9e05c5f036b8fbf67972470f240e84f7595223a

commit_message:
fix file read permission in baremetal deploy

adds command filter for cat. As baremetal deploy process needs to
read the deploy images /etc/passwd file as root.

Change-Id: I5e75e167b53c7a3ef5062f8d549fcf0e375cb0c0
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Added Postgres CI opportunistic test case

Added test case and support functions for CI opportunistic testing using
a PostgreSQL database, as part of our postgresql as a first class citizen
effort.

Fixes:
bug 1084567

Change-Id: I9d153157cf3b1e64b5ce5e4709f5fa66fe55a814

Joe, Heat was on a much older version, so while doing the recent pep fixups, I decided to use the latest 1.3.4, assuming that it was a superset of 1.3.3.  Thanks for pointing out the message though, perhaps we should relax our tox.ini to 1.3.3, but having done all the work to align with 1.3.4 I'm not really that keen to go backwards.

commit_message:
Update WebOb version specification

Now that the other projects are using WebOb>=1.2 we can
specify that, too.

See bug #1092227 for details.

Change-Id: Ifcb99354f405d9f4dc113d01d83b2a9d76660fc5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

subject: Remove the ImageSizePollster
messages:
[{'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-01-16 14:52:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The point of having different class is to be able to disable some pollsters. I admit it's badly implemented now, but I think you remove that ability here."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-16 15:01:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/19810/1/check/gate-ceilometer-docs/107 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/19810/1/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/1233 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/19810/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python27-folsom/440 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2013-01-16 15:03:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You are correct.

A bit curious that why don't  have the configuration to decide the counters to be returned and merge all pollster to same source as a big one. It will be more efficient other than splitting the pollster into multiple smaller one. Any reason I missed?

Another choice is, we can add this change after we implement the suggestion from Doug on the discussion of driving the main loop through pipeline. At that time, we can passing counter list to the get_counters. The pipeline will decide it which counter will be needed."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-01-16 15:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I"m pretty sure that can be fixed correctly with multi-publisher.'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2013-01-16 15:12:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Possibly even at that time it's better to have a option for pollster to disable some counter to be disabled, and then merge all smaller pollster into bigger one?"}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2013-01-17 11:54:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure if anyone will really want to disable these two pollster separately, while it benefits if a lot of images in the glance.

So would you prefer to get this in now, or, after the multiple publisher is done, the different interval bp is done?

--jyh"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-01-17 17:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Remove the ImageSizePollster

We can use generator to achieve this purpose simply.

Change-Id: Id05c33fb2aa89fd02035c717417d0181e975c3ec

> Why the _ in quantum/tests/unit/'_'test_extension_portbindings.py ?

This class itself does not work alone since at now the port binding extension does not have its own base plugin implementation. The class is intended to be used by unit tests of an individual plugin. It is the reason the the file name has a prefix '_'. If the filename starts with 'test_', unittest tries to run tests in the module and it will fail.
Does it make sense?"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-01-18 13:04:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)
