commit_message:
Provide better error message for aggregate-create

For an InvalidAggregateAction exception:
Before: 'ERROR: There was a conflict when trying to complete your request (HTTP 409)'
After: 'ERROR: Cannot perform action 'create_aggregate' on aggregate 'N/A'. Reason: invalid zone. (HTTP 400)'

docImpact

Fix bug 1083353

Change-Id: I26e30059fe5bbc30eecc52cccec4eba2a57d00db
(cherry picked from commit 4e43747037058522087e6eb71ef3bcce266d55cc)

For the stable maintainers: this is a useful backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19332/ for setting unlimited quotas using Horizon (currently the form only accepts positive values, making unlimited quotas impossible to set or edit).

Joe, thank you for the patch. Note that it would probably be better to wait for the master branch patch to be approved before submitting a backport in general, so that the reviews can apply to both (e.g. it would be nice to also have a test for the Folsom branch). Also, in the future the change-id should be the same for both patches [0].

Tested in devstack Folsom, lgtm.

commit_message:
Allow setting nova quotas to unlimited

To set a quota to unlimited it is set to -1

Fix bug 1082489

Change-Id: I2e1e53f6a5a33f2b248decc9d94f5a430f383508

commit_message:
Limit formatting routes when adding resources

By default, routes.mapper.Mapper.resource adds a bunch of formatted
routes that accept anything after a '.'. Our spec says only .xml
and .json are accepted so limit the formatting to those valuse.

This allows identifiers with a '.' in urls. A few tests were added
to the extensions test to prove that .xml and .json are stripped
but other values are not.

Fixes bug 1027788

Change-Id: Ic888aa5d75050d6b14763c2a787ac8c8d5ab1f69
(cherry picked from commit 8935c3bde9e9635f65522488c1aca5df5b03050d)

commit_message:
Allow running of sql against the live DB.

Reordered the tables in the domain downgrade script to avoid breaking the integrity constraints

To run the test:
./run_tests.sh -N  test_sql_upgrade

This version removed all of the code specific to running against a live DB and merged it into the
standard tests.

Fixed a couple downgrade functions that were failing.  They had not
been tested

Change-Id: Ie1214e5543bd08fde95652af2464cc9c80db449d

[{'created': '2013-01-16 18:08:35.000000000', 'message': "Stop using no longer valid -E option for pip

Fixes bug 1100403

Version 1.1 of pip dropped the -E option. It's not necessary anyway since
running pip in a correctly setup virtualenv will automatically do the right
thing.

Change-Id: Ifec9f27b8dc169d594125a0808126abe77ed42e7
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using no longer valid -E option for pip

Fixes bug 1100403

Version 1.1 of pip dropped the -E option. It's not necessary anyway since
running pip in a correctly setup virtualenv will automatically do the right
thing.

Change-Id: Ifec9f27b8dc169d594125a0808126abe77ed42e7

It fixes CentOS-specific package dependency. pip install pyOpenSSL
will work well after installing openssl-devel package.

commit_message:
Add CentOS-specific OpenSSL package installation.

Add openssl-devel package installation procedure to tools/install_venv.py
It fixes CentOS-specific package dependency. pip install pyOpenSSL
will work well after installing openssl-devel package.

Change-Id: Ia8c5cdd48260996e33b752ccb956c9e072a8f3d8

Needs some other reviews to pass first'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-03 18:45:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The name of the dependency should be "WebOb", to be consistent with the other projects and to use the correct distribution name.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-01-03 18:48:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-03 19:16:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

In the patches I submitted for other projects I pegged the version to 1.2.3. The 1.2 release series includes some changes to make it backwards-compatible with 1.0, and those changes may not have all been in the 1.1 series.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-01-03 19:27:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm more concerned about future releases, not just what we know about today."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-03 20:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sure. That's why I said "==1.2.3" instead of a fuzzier match with >=.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-01-03 20:46:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ah - I misunderstood your previous comment. Let's do that in this case, then."}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2013-01-07 13:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-07 14:10:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18038/3/check/gate-glance-docs/1320 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18038/3/check/gate-glance-pep8/3254 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18038/3/check/gate-glance-python26/2758 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18038/3/check/gate-glance-python27/2772 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18038/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/24649 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/18038/3/check/gate-devstack-vm-quantum/1214 : FAILURE (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-07 15:16:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-07 16:02:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

At Monty's suggestion, I have submitted new changes to Cinder, Nova, and Oslo to allow WebOb to be >=1.0.8 as a temporary measure to avoid the conflicts. So, we could either do something similar for Glance or go ahead and move up to ==1.2.3 (I prefer the latter, but we could go in stages if you prefer)."}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2013-01-08 08:04:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

If glance is the only component with a fixed version requirement I guess it's ok to do so."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-01-08 16:06:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

This seems reasonable, and since glance is last project to change version, we can jump straight to 1.2.3 (instead of using >=1.0.8 as an intermediate step).

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-01-08 20:20:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Is it reasonable to expect v1.2.3 to be available through Ubuntu and Fedora packages?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-09 13:42:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yes, the folks from Canonical are working on 1.2.3 packaging now. It is included in the Raring archives already, and will be in the cloud archives repo for Precise users.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-01-09 17:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I can only seem to find python-webob 1.2.1 packaged for Fedora - should we either relax the dependency to 1.2.X or wait until we know 1.2.3 is ready there?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-01-10 17:51:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Using >=1.2 should work.'}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2013-01-11 08:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-11 09:39:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Relax version constraint on Webob-1.0.8

And set it to WebOb 1.2 or later instead. This is consistend with requirements
in other projects.

Change-Id: I3f6c2a632d933b31baa781e367eaf615cb7b8ee9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-15 19:50:45.000000000', 'message': 'Peg the version of Ming used in tests

Up until today we have needed to use a git checkout of Ming
to get some changes we pushed upstream but that were not
released. Release 0.3.2 includes all of our changes, so we
can now update our requirements to use it and stop using
the git head.

Change-Id: I4a3c242259c279b1e1be86d280572dd8cd26e84e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Peg the version of Ming used in tests

Up until today we have needed to use a git checkout of Ming
to get some changes we pushed upstream but that were not
released. Release 0.3.2 includes all of our changes, so we
can now update our requirements to use it and stop using
the git head.

Change-Id: I4a3c242259c279b1e1be86d280572dd8cd26e84e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Use default_if_none rather than default filter

Zero is a valid summation for a column, so only default to
a hyphen when a summation is explicitly None.

Change-Id: Ib523657ca46f9f2563ddb82cb2a3b64d9458979d

commit_message:
Fix ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED comparison errors

Fixes bug #1099663

Replaced equality operators used with ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED to 'is' or 'is not'.
Used is_attr_set() where comparsion is done to None and ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED.

Change-Id: I67c87051b46ca0518fa777cbb1c3e6141a533b61

commit_message:
Add migration for network bindings in NVP plugin

Bug 1099895

Ensures the table nvp_network_bindings is created when upgrading
database to head, by adding an appropriate alembic migration

Change-Id: I4a794ed0ec6866d657cb2470d5aa67828e81aa75

commit_message:
Enhance wsgi to listen on ipv6 address

Check if the hostname is ipv6 and set the family appropriately.
Add tests to ensure that IPv6 and IPv6 with SSL works properly.

Change-Id: Ibcf0a9387691d124888c0c0540d4322b0a3b3d67

commit_message:
Enable token scoping to a domain

This documents v3 api changes to allow a token to be scoped
do a domain as well as a project.  Now that keystone supports
RBAC on its own APIs along with domain level entities (like
users and groups), then it is appropriate to allow token
scoping to a domain to facilitate supporting roles like
Domain Administrators.

blueprint domain-scoping

Since they are so interrelated, this proposal also fixes
defect 1081681 (Unclear how domain_id is set for a user in v3 api).

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ica8594055f0a6bbb3fcda5a75a90eda45aac47d3

commit_message:
Enable tenants to set non-owned ext network as router gateway

Bug 1087243

Avoid loading external networks subnets in tenant's context, as this
might lead to the subnet not being found because it's owned by a
different tenant

Change-Id: Ic4c429c9e667da939ede0aa07a12c0f5a17e212c

Indeed, I think this amounts to a "contract" change. That means it's something we can't do in the current API, but likely can consider for a future version. Arguably the difference between XML and JSON in this instance could still be considered a bug, so I don't know that I agree that it's invalid, just not right now.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-11-02 11:17:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Stub out find_file... fix policy.json test issue.

Updates test_policy.py so that we stub out find_file
which is used to find the *default* policy file. This
fixes an issue in the test_policy_file_default_not_found
test where it *may* fail when executed on a machine with
Glance package(s) installed (thus created a file in /etc/glance/
that isn't readable by the test user).

Fixes LP Bug #1098687.

Change-Id: If2912d40608ffb07f457454fdc6ebc56c62f6eaf

VM launches normally take 30 seconds; sometimes they take slightly more than 60.  Based on Nachi's analysis, normal devstack runs are affected by this 1% of the time, quantum runs 6%.

That suggests that this won't really mask a problem, and it's not the case that quantum has a huge problem that needs to be addressed.  Nachi thinks that because the quantum jobs launch more vms, they are more likely to encounter the issue.

We should definitely keep an eye on this, however."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2013-01-15 21:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Timeout job takes about 60 sec on launching VMs,
so we increase ACTIVE_TIMEOUT now.

commit_message:
Add Volume group credentials for cinder tests.

Currently the volume tests are using the credentials from
the compute section of config. This change adds credentials
to the volume section of config and uses them for the volume
tests.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-16 19:04:23.000000000', 'message': 'Log warn if quantum core and/or plugin config missing.

bug 1059923

Addresses quantum server, and linuxbridge, ovs, ryu, and nec
plugin agents generating a warnign log message, when config files
are missing. Check to see if core_plugin attribute exists to tell if
the core config file is there. Check # config files to see if a plugin
config is there. For server, tested these cases:

no conf specifed (uses /etc/quantum/quantum.conf) -> warn plugin cfg missing
core conf specified -------------------------------> warn plugin cfg missing
core + plugin conf specified ----------------------> no warning
plugin conf specified -----------------------------> no warning

For last test case, (existing) CRITICAL msg will be displayed by the server.

For plugins, tested these cases:

no conf specifed (uses /etc/quantum/quantum.conf) -> warn plugin cfg missing
core conf specified -------------------------------> warn plugin cfg missing
core + plugin conf specified ----------------------> no warning
plugin conf specified -----------------------------> warn core config missing

Change-Id: I41be9ef2fc88e4a1bf321e7fe662d28babe08795
'}]
commit_message:
Log warn if quantum core and/or plugin config missing.

bug 1059923

Addresses quantum server, and linuxbridge, ovs, ryu, and nec
plugin agents generating a warnign log message, when config files
are missing. Check to see if core_plugin attribute exists to tell if
the core config file is there. Check # config files to see if a plugin
config is there. For server, tested these cases:

no conf specifed (uses /etc/quantum/quantum.conf) -> warn plugin cfg missing
core conf specified -------------------------------> warn plugin cfg missing
core + plugin conf specified ----------------------> no warning
plugin conf specified -----------------------------> no warning

For last test case, (existing) CRITICAL msg will be displayed by the server.

For plugins, tested these cases:

no conf specifed (uses /etc/quantum/quantum.conf) -> warn plugin cfg missing
core conf specified -------------------------------> warn plugin cfg missing
core + plugin conf specified ----------------------> no warning
plugin conf specified -----------------------------> warn core config missing

Change-Id: I41be9ef2fc88e4a1bf321e7fe662d28babe08795

commit_message:
Make resource tracker use conductor for listing instances

This patch extends the conductor manager's get_all_by_host() method
to take an optional node parameter, which will cause the additional
filtering, if present. It also makes resource tracker use the
conductor for getting instances on the current host/node.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute

Change-Id: I407757d356b4162f32da29924175175a40f88f13

commit_message:
Make resource tracker use conductor for listing compute nodes

This makes the resource tracker use the existing conductor method
of service_get_all_compute_by_host() instead of querying the
database directly.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute

Change-Id: Iee19eeaa8651e4df0abb974f3f3ddeafd9d23409

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-07 18:45:11.000000000', 'message': "Make Quantum plugin fill in the 'bridge' name

There is a comment in the quantum driver code that says it
ignores the 'bridge' name field. This is misleading, because
the bridge name is still required by any virt drivers when
configuring VIFs so they know how to connect them.

Currently the libvirt Bridge driver invents a bridge name
based on 'qbr' and network['id'], while the OVS drivers
use the libvirt_ovs_bridge config. Move this logic into
the Quantum driver, renaming the config option to
quantum_ovs_bridge. The config option should go away completely
once Quantum can pass across the name, as it does for vif_type

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: Ib043e1e6af5712ae1d1665cdca2e9fdbc89d4351
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2013-01-07 22:24:30.000000000', 'message': "Make Quantum plugin fill in the 'bridge' name

commit_message:
Make Quantum plugin fill in the 'bridge' name

There is a comment in the quantum driver code that says it
ignores the 'bridge' name field. This is misleading, because
the bridge name is still required by any virt drivers when
configuring VIFs so they know how to connect them.

Currently the libvirt Bridge driver invents a bridge name
based on 'qbr' and network['id'], while the OVS drivers
use the libvirt_ovs_bridge config. Move this logic into
the Quantum driver, renaming the config option to
quantum_ovs_bridge. The config option should go away completely
once Quantum can pass across the name, as it does for vif_type

Blueprint: libvirt-vif-driver
Change-Id: Ib043e1e6af5712ae1d1665cdca2e9fdbc89d4351
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
wsgi.Middleware forward-compatibility with webob 1.2b1 or later

Response.request is None by default
(http://docs.webob.org/en/latest/news.html#b1), but is used in the
CacheFilter WSGI middleware.

Backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17794/

Change-Id: I28f5ca92fe517f4f56af934799db32650e079ba7

[{'created': '2012-12-14 12:45:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix errors in used_limits extension

Fixes bug #1062049

There was a typo mapping the security groups resource to floating IPs.

Key pairs don't work with the extension because of bug #1089877.

(cherry picked from commit 6c9d9ab)

Change-Id: Ifd694b21fef1dc95e67c07dcef0cd6ea3daa8d53
"}]
commit_message:
Fix errors in used_limits extension

Fixes bug #1062049

There was a typo mapping the security groups resource to floating IPs.

Key pairs don't work with the extension because of bug #1089877.

(cherry picked from commit 6c9d9ab)

Change-Id: Ifd694b21fef1dc95e67c07dcef0cd6ea3daa8d53

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-16 07:52:37.000000000', 'message': 'Removes paramiko dependency from test-requires

Removing the paramiko dependency from tools/test-requires because it already
exists in tools/pip-requires. The tox.ini file includes both pip-requires and
test-requires and tox aborts because the dependency is essentially specified twice
(even though they do not have contradictory version requirements)

Change-Id: Ifc68f9ee52ed9b0dffc73c9cb710f611b3471051
'}]
commit_message:
Removes paramiko dependency from test-requires

Removing the paramiko dependency from tools/test-requires because it already
exists in tools/pip-requires. The tox.ini file includes both pip-requires and
test-requires and tox aborts because the dependency is essentially specified twice
(even though they do not have contradictory version requirements)

Change-Id: Ifc68f9ee52ed9b0dffc73c9cb710f611b3471051

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-16 02:26:06.000000000', 'message': 'Document Trusted Compute Pools

Describe how to configure for using Trusted Compute Pools.

Based on:
 *  http://wiki.openstack.org/TrustedComputingPools
 *  https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg18825.html
 (Email from Dale Stewart)

 See also:
 *  http://wiki.openstack.org/OpenAttestation

 This patch also introduces a new chapter called "Security
 Hardening" into the Compute Admin guide. I expect this chapter
 will eventually include discussions on how to integrate with
 other security-related tech, e.g., SELinux/sVirt.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/16783

This is a backport of an older commit that hadn't been merged.

Change-Id: I6f2bfb28496b5d2115dd2d2649f431ae35635891
'}]
commit_message:
Document Trusted Compute Pools

Describe how to configure for using Trusted Compute Pools.

Based on:
 *  http://wiki.openstack.org/TrustedComputingPools
 *  https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg18825.html
 (Email from Dale Stewart)

 See also:
 *  http://wiki.openstack.org/OpenAttestation

 This patch also introduces a new chapter called "Security
 Hardening" into the Compute Admin guide. I expect this chapter
 will eventually include discussions on how to integrate with
 other security-related tech, e.g., SELinux/sVirt.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/16783

This is a backport of an older commit that hadn't been merged.

Change-Id: I6f2bfb28496b5d2115dd2d2649f431ae35635891

commit_message:
Create localhost MySQL accounts for keystone,glance,nova.

Document that you need to create an @'localhost' account as well as
an @'%' account in MySQL for keystone, nova, and glance.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/16828

(This is an old commit to master that never got pushed back into
folsom)

Change-Id: I4fcbf03a6cd443bbe94a5f41f91bbccd08017efd

commit_message:
Move migration_get_..._by_host_and_node to conductor

This moves the remaining migration-related database call out of the
resource tracker to conductor:

  migration_get_in_progress_by_host_and_node()

Related to blueprint no-db-compute

Change-Id: I9bdf9fbbc3131964bf6078d19bf1cd9053a7e224

subject: Adds in a narrative form of glance client walkthrough as requested
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-11 21:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/gate-openstack-cli-guide/check/109/cli/quick-start : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-01-12 00:05:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The content is fine - just raising this: As a developer, I'm not sure I'd find this in a "CLI guide". Especially not under a heading "Command List for glance CLI" ;)

As from the first paragraph: "While it is perfectly acceptable to issue HTTP requests directly to
			9	  Glance via its RESTful API, sometimes it is better to be able to
			10	  access and modify image resources via a client class that removes some
			11	  of the complexity and tedium of dealing with raw HTTP requests."

I'd be looking at putting this somewhere that had an "API" flavour.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-01-14 19:11:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

OH! I think I have completely misplaced this whole type of content. It probably belongs in the Programming with Python guide -- http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-compute/programmer/content/. What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-01-16 03:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes, that sounds better.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-01-16 16:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

This information does not belong in the CLI guide.'}]

commit_message:
Add support for configuring SPICE graphics with libvirt

Add support to the libvirt driver to configure SPICE graphics
and the SPICE guest agent. It allows for enablement of both
VNC and SPICE at the same time, since some recent libvirt/KVM
versions support this concurrent mode.

The USB tablet will now only be enabled if VNC is requested,
or SPICE is requested without the agent

Blueprint: libvirt-spice
Change-Id: Ic7fbfd636455aba5bf881b6a1925fd4561edfd15
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Updates prerequisite packages for fedora

Adds gcc, libxslt-devel (has dependency on libxml2-devel) and mysql-devel to
the list of prerequisites

<channel> elements in libvirt XML config is required

commit_message:
Add support for setting up <channel> elements in libvirt config

To enable use of guest agents, support for configuring the
<channel> elements in libvirt XML config is required

Blueprint: libvirt-spice
Change-Id: I3cea7b326bb2f746c5804d0aa3bbe369da6935e8
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

We're not using groups much yet, but we'll eventually be moving to using them a lot more so it's better for new options to use them. See https://etherpad.openstack.org/grizzly-nova-config-options

Just need to do:

  CONF.register_opts(spice_opts, group='spice')

and remove the spice prefix from all the option names"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-01-07 13:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-01-07 14:09:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Add common config options for SPICE graphics

The VNC config options are shared across hypervisor drivers, and
while SPICE originally only supported KVM, it is now possible to
use it with Xen too. Thus, adding common SPICE config options
makes more sense than adding them to the libvirt driver only

DocImpact
Blueprint: libvirt-spice
Change-Id: I8e817530908c6fee0781b92dc9e27010951b4540
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

diff --git a/tools/hacking.py b/tools/hacking.py
index 3ca6d01..d647d87 100755
--- a/tools/hacking.py
+++ b/tools/hacking.py
@@ -131,7 +131,7 @@ def nova_except_format(logical_line):
     Do not write "except:", use "except Exception:" at the very least
 
     Okay: except Exception:
-    N201: except:
+    Okay: except:
     """
     if logical_line.startswith("except:"):
         yield 6, "N201: no 'except:' at least use 'except Exception:'"

$ pep8 --version

commit_message:
enable hacking.py self tests

pep8 and hacking.py (by inheritance) have the ability to run self
tests via docstrings, if we format the comments correctly, and change
the docstring test regex. Include self testing in our normal pep8
tests.

fix the comments to actually be test case compliant

fix nova_import_alphabetical to pass on short import lists (only 2
lines, starting at the beginning of a file)

comment where it doesn't appear that hacking.py tests are working
(though there could be deeper black magic in some of them).

fix a doc string in pep8 self tests that breaks N301

fix the fact that pep8 error strings are supposed to start with
\w\d\d\d, we were just lucking out on some formatting because the
string NOVA happened to be only 4 chars long.

Add a couple of escapes so that we don't recursively fail on our
own fail self tests for comments. (boy that's fun)

Change-Id: I14d5e04cfc092b37ec4967cd7485e9975a5eb820

I meant to ask, is the kwapi service likely to become part of OpenStack, or used commonly with OpenStack deployments? I don't have an issue adding the pollster here either way, but I do want to make sure it's clear that it doesn't have to be part of the ceilometer code base in order for ceilometer to load it and use it. That's one of the benefits of using entry points, we can discover pollsters in other packages."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-01-08 10:38:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Given that my blueprint is not publicly available, I summarize it here.

- Drivers: receive values from wattmeters and forward them on a bus (ZeroMQ).

- Plugins: listen the bus and process received data.

Kwapi is part of the XLcloud project (HPC cloud).

commit_message:
Add Kwapi pollster (energy monitoring).

Given that my blueprint is not publicly available, I summarize it here.

Kwapi (kilowatt API) contains the following modules:
- Drivers: receive values from wattmeters and forward them on a bus (ZeroMQ).
Wattmeter drivers are specific to each wattmeters (Wattsup, OmegaWatt, etc).
- Plugins: listen the bus and process received data.
Currently, there is two plugins: the ceilometer plugin (REST API) and a visualization plugin (build graphs with RRDtool).

Kwapi is part of the XLcloud project (HPC cloud).
http://www.xlcloud.org

Repository:
https://github.com/stackforge/kwapi

Change-Id: Ieaaa1db9c8c569b6ee9f0815e03879f8b3f3e282

nvp plugin since mock is not an install dependency. This patch

'}]
commit_message:
quantum-plugin-nicira imports mock but was not used

The import of mock prevents quantum from starting when using the
nvp plugin since mock is not an install dependency. This patch
removes where mock was imported but did not actually need to be.

Fixes bug 1097451

Change-Id: If1569d437fe523e4fac8d686da52b0508ca1cbf3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-16 14:11:46.000000000', 'message': 'Provide "atomic" database access for networks

Fixes bug 1093637

In the OVS and LB plugins there are cases when accessing the network
has an additional database query. The patch enables this to occur
without accessing an invalid database entry.

Change-Id: I7d4944cf3240819f23dd7b4993d6ae3cefab9dc2
'}]
commit_message:
Provide "atomic" database access for networks

Fixes bug 1093637

In the OVS and LB plugins there are cases when accessing the network
has an additional database query. The patch enables this to occur
without accessing an invalid database entry.

Change-Id: I7d4944cf3240819f23dd7b4993d6ae3cefab9dc2

Volume-API, Volume-Manager and Volume-Driver changes as needed.

'}]
commit_message:
Add capability to set QoS on Cinder Volumes

This change implements IOP based QoS capabilities for thos Cinder
back-ends that support it.  This includes min-iops, max-iops and burst-iops.

Includes OS-API extensions for setting via cinderclient or other tools,
Volume-API, Volume-Manager and Volume-Driver changes as needed.

Associated python-cinderclient changes are also completed and currently
held as WIP at Change-Id: I66d9fdecf7086dc72eea65d65ef1f7c35ed9ad10

Implements cinder portion of blueprint add-qos-capability

Change-Id: I54962fed3ca1ad743d9501fbc48d07f3f114eec1

Add CentOS-specific OpenSSL package installation.

You'll need a rebase and add shred to rootwrap.  I'm still reluctant to put this in.  Shred is nice but run it against a 2 Gig snapshot and I've been waiting more than 30 minutes for it to complete.

Maybe change the args to "-n 1"??  The interesting thing is I haven't hit the kernel hang as of yet.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-01-09 01:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Wow 30 mins? I chose the values based on testing here:

$ truncate -s2G file.test
$ time shred -n3 -v file.test
real	0m56.235s
user	0m4.227s
sys	0m19.765s

So the above was disk bound as indicated by the low sys+user.
Note I changed shred to use an internal pseudorandom 
generator by default, so that it could proceed at the
speed of the disk. But that was nearly 4 years ago,
so you should have that with shred >= 7.3'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-01-09 02:10:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah.. now on a volume we're looking at 3 minutes.  The problem is LVM snaps have horrid performance.  

Regardless, I like your change for the formal flexibility, but I unfortunately still need to come up with a solution for the LVM issues on 12.04.  I'm hoping to get a patch up with thin prov in the next day or two."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-01-09 02:49:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Restored'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-01-09 02:50:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-09 04:56:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

[{'created': '2012-09-06 19:46:55.000000000', 'message': "support a configurable volume wiping method

Add a clear_volume() method that is called from delete_method().
This is only implemented at present for the base LVM driver.
This new clear_volume() method now supports these config vars:

  volume_clear = none, zero, shred
  volume_clear_size = size_in_MiB

'zero' is the default method and unchanged from previously.
'none' is used if security isn't a concern, or there is
  independent volume scrubbing.
'shred' is for more security conscious situations where
an overwrite count is required. Currently this defaults to 3 passes.

size_in_MiB can be used to limit the cleared area to the first
part of the volume, which can greatly speed up the operation,
and can be useful with encrypted volumes for example where
overwritting the encryption keys at the start is sufficient.

Fixes bug: 1022511

commit_message:
support a configurable volume wiping method

Add a clear_volume() method that is called from delete_method().
This is only implemented at present for the base LVM driver.
This new clear_volume() method now supports these config vars:

  volume_clear = none, zero, shred
  volume_clear_size = size_in_MiB

'zero' is the default method and unchanged from previously.
'none' is used if security isn't a concern, or there is
  independent volume scrubbing.
'shred' is for more security conscious situations where
an overwrite count is required. Currently this defaults to 3 passes.

size_in_MiB can be used to limit the cleared area to the first
part of the volume, which can greatly speed up the operation,
and can be useful with encrypted volumes for example where
overwritting the encryption keys at the start is sufficient.

Fixes bug: 1022511
Change-Id: I7312678ff5d66156578501483a1b74e2a69e19a0

commit_message:
Trusts

sql and kvs backends
sql upgrade scripts
sql specific unit tests
trust controller
create tests
token for trust added to AuthController Authenticate
Authenticates only user can be trustor in create

Change-Id: I87b42520691f14ae5fd423d1ed2ede71b4a4382b

I realize these are auto generated, but the style guidelines prefer (...) to handle long lines instead of \. It would be nice if the generator could output this instead.

Very happy to see this work coming out!'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-01-07 17:04:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I'm opposed to this approach in general. I'm not really sure how to articulate my opposition, but I'll try:

I think that this approach ends up adding a ton of bloat and meaningless code to the tree, which ends up just performing mappings between some input and some output, without a lot of ... sanity. It seems to be a wedge in the middle of things to make the tests work, but tests can really only be run in a meaningful way on windows.

I don't really understand why so many points have to be mocked out, when really WMI is all that needs to be faked. I still support fixing this problem with a proper fake implementation that mimics all of the WMI (or any other OS-level interface) behaviors, like the other drivers do. Unit tests for the fake can provide additional guarantees that the fake is doing the right thing. This is what the other drivers do and it seems to work fine.

Concern over someone modifying the WMI interface layer without actual testing can be handled in just the same way as whenever I make changes to xenapi that I can't test: someone -1s me :)"}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-01-08 23:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-16 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-01-16 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

commit_message:
Hyper-V new unit tests mock modules and classes

Modules and classes required for Hyper-V API unit tests.
The files included in this commit are used by the new testing framework,
replacing the serialized (pickled) objects used before.

Change-Id: I5c9ca04a0033d6f839de06f59f0444f0779670a1

commit_message:
Add capability to update volume metadata.

This addresses some cleanup and bugs with volume metadata updates
on the cinder side.  Mostly this implements v1/volume_metadata api
and adds things like propery checks to cinder.volume.api.update_volume_meta.

NOTE: This is only for api V1, a seperate patch will be provided for
V2 once this lands.

The remainder of the bp will be implemented in a cinderclient patch to follow.
Implement cinder side of blueprint update-vol-metadata

Also fixes bug: 1096018

Change-Id: I6f369d6381c45a57fcb5cf8e034529f174e66a8c

[{'created': '2013-01-16 04:53:10.000000000', 'message': 'Support Port Binding Extension in NEC plugin

Fixes bug 1099894
nova/network/quantumv2/api fill the bridge name according to
binding:vif_type attribute passed from Quantum. Otherwise the bridge
is set to None and launching an instance will fail.

blueprint vif-plugging-improvements

Note that binding:capabilities is under discussion and it may be
changed in the future. This commit just adds NEC plugin support
same as OVS and Linux bridge plugin.

Change-Id: I4ee3dd17a033c64d27438b98e3aa61ca406b0a76
'}]
commit_message:
Support Port Binding Extension in NEC plugin

Fixes bug 1099894
nova/network/quantumv2/api fill the bridge name according to
binding:vif_type attribute passed from Quantum. Otherwise the bridge
is set to None and launching an instance will fail.

blueprint vif-plugging-improvements

Note that binding:capabilities is under discussion and it may be
changed in the future. This commit just adds NEC plugin support
same as OVS and Linux bridge plugin.

Change-Id: I4ee3dd17a033c64d27438b98e3aa61ca406b0a76

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-16 04:42:05.000000000', 'message': "Display security group name in security-group-rule-list

It is useful to display security group name rather than its id
for security_group_id and source_group_id.

Also add '--no-nameconv' option to disable conversion from
security group id to its name. When security-group-rule-list is executed
by admin user it is likely more than one groups have same name.
This option is useful for such cases.

Change-Id: I7fd0f1fb26fce8ed24e0f710666866607e681bc8
"}, {'created': '2013-01-16 04:42:05.000000000', 'message': "Display security group name in security-group-rule-list

It is useful to display security group name rather than its id
for security_group_id and source_group_id.

Also add '--no-nameconv' option to disable conversion from
security group id to its name. When security-group-rule-list is executed
by admin user it is likely more than one groups have same name.
This option is useful for such cases.

Change-Id: I7fd0f1fb26fce8ed24e0f710666866607e681bc8
"}, {'created': '2013-01-16 04:42:05.000000000', 'message': "Display security group name in security-group-rule-list

It is useful to display security group name rather than its id
for security_group_id and source_group_id.

Also add '--no-nameconv' option to disable conversion from
security group id to its name. When security-group-rule-list is executed
by admin user it is likely more than one groups have same name.
This option is useful for such a case.

This commit introduces _extend_list() in ListCommand class. This method
can be used to update a retrieved list (e.g., add additional information
or convert some field to more human-readable value).

Change-Id: I7fd0f1fb26fce8ed24e0f710666866607e681bc8

commit_message:
Display security group name in security-group-rule-list

It is useful to display security group name rather than its id
for security_group_id and source_group_id.

Also add '--no-nameconv' option to disable conversion from
security group id to its name. When security-group-rule-list is executed
by admin user it is likely more than one groups have same name.
This option is useful for such cases.

Change-Id: I7fd0f1fb26fce8ed24e0f710666866607e681bc8

commit_message:
Add basic uec image preparation to tempest

Add uec image preparation to lib/tempest.
cirros as image is hard coded at the moment.

If the images does not exists or the system is not able to use uec images the
image prepare step will be skipped and tempest will skip the related
tests as well.

Setting ssh username correctly.
Setting instance type for the boto test.

Change-Id: I0d36ac7834e1eb677007e2c92dfc375d134a6023

commit_message:
Make WebOb version specification more flexible

Change the WebOb version to >=1.0.8 as a temporary
measure to allow the actual version update to 1.2.3
to roll out across the projects one at a time without
breaking the integration tests.

Change-Id: Ia4f9f92ae7013098706924eef8728bcd85869c29
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

Webob has basically the same problem, but of course they don't have a request argument.  So they just special case the HEAD, and then later when building the app_iter they'll create a request obj only if they're doing a conditional responses.

    def __call__(self, environ, start_response):
        """
        WSGI application interface
        """
        if self.conditional_response:
            return self.conditional_response_app(environ, start_response)
        headerlist = self._abs_headerlist(environ)
        start_response(self.status, headerlist)
        if environ['REQUEST_METHOD'] == 'HEAD':
            # Special case here...
            return EmptyResponse(self._app_iter)
        return self._app_iter

For my part, I'm not worried about a creating a few extra request objects here and there, especially once redbo get's in the query param parsing cacheing ;)'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-01-12 01:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Note that there may still be some problem with swift3 (some issue with Cyberduck when it tries to retrieve metadata on containers/objects).

themadcanudist (kostecky) is getting more info on that failure.

I still think this patch is solid (helps a specific problem w/HEAD requests having bodies), though.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-01-14 21:52:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I, too, like this patch.

Looks like we're waiting for possible comments from Michael Barton; if we don't get any by tomorrow, I'll approve this patch then. It's got plenty of +2s."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-15 22:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

commit_message:
Fix HEAD request response when request not given to response.

If a middleware (swift3, I'm looking at you), doesn't pass a Request
object into the Response constructor, Response._response_iter cannot
know to send zero bytes in the body of the HEAD response.

This patch fixes this usage of swob by making Response.__call__
helpfully reify self.request from env if it wasn't already set by the
Response object's constructor.

This fixes a bug in swift3 + swob-enabled-Swift where HEAD requests to
swift3 resulted in a response with a body in violation of the relevant
RFC and confusing clients.

Thanks to kostecky for finding the bug and describing it accurately.

Change-Id: I2bdb098052b161e1cddf1e4e482ab4dfafeb18c0

commit_message:
Reject user ports that have MACs the hypervisor cannot use.

If a hypervisor has requested specific MAC addresses, ports requested
by the user have to be in that set of MAC addresses, or they cannot be
used. Raising an error at network allocation time is cleaner than
waiting for the hypervisor to attempt to plug its vifs and error.

Change-Id: If556cc518a01df658044e3ba6b9d7584bfabe588

commit_message:
Override floating interface on callee side

We allow individual nodes to override the floating interface by setting
public_interface=XXX on the node. Unfortunately in multi_host an
associate or disassociate call can be forwarded from one host to
another. Currently the override happens on the caller side instead of
the callee side. This fixes the issue by moving the override.

Fixes bug 1096987

Change-Id: I37fbbf9e0ee0ffbe8c8754649301371b98da9f4f

'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-12-16 03:58:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd like to ultimately gate on a check like this, in order to avoid people accidentally breaking the build."}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-12-17 00:34:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Awesome idea!

Two comments:

1) This doesn't appear to work with the xml in the API samples, which I don't believe should necessarily conform to docbook. Thoughts?

2A) Can you use something like `git rev-parse --show-toplevel` to get the top level of the checked out git repo, so this can be run from anywhere, rather than having to be in the tools directory - due to os.walk("../doc/src/docbkx") ?

2B) Alternately, should we just change the walk path to the current working directory ?'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-12-17 04:04:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Tom:

1. If they aren't DocBook, we should probably parse them to check for XML syntax errors but not do a schema validation, but I didn't see where they are in my local checkout. Where are these non-DocBook API sample XML files? I couldn't find them in my local repo. 

2. We probably should let the user specify an argument on the command-line for the top-level directory. If they don't specify it, we should default to *something*. I think that `git rev-parse --show-toplevel`/doc/src/docbkx is is a good candidate for this because we should (I hope!) be able to safely assume that all of the DocBook-related files live in that directory.

Right now the script seems to be repeating the same error multiple times in the output, and I swear that was happening to me the other day, so I'm going to set this to WIP while I figure out what's going wrong."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-12-17 04:04:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

Validation script does not seem to be outputting correctly.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-12-17 15:51:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

1. If they aren't DocBook, we should probably parse them to check for XML syntax errors but not do a schema validation, but I didn't see where they are in my local checkout. Where are these non-DocBook API sample XML files? I couldn't find them in my local repo.

---The sample API XML files are in openstack/api-site, not openstack-manuals repo. 

2. We probably should let the user specify an argument on the command-line for the top-level directory. If they don't specify it, we should default to *something*. I think that `git rev-parse --show-toplevel`/doc/src/docbkx is is a good candidate for this because we should (I hope!) be able to safely assume that all of the DocBook-related files live in that directory.

--- This looks like a safe assumption to me."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-12-18 01:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-18 01:51:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18170/3/check/gate-noop/16 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-12-18 01:53:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I changed the behavior of the default path, this is ready for review now.

If reviewing, please make sure you can run the script. Right now, it's producing errors for the following two files:

doc/src/docbkx/openstack-compute-admin/computeconfigure.xml
doc/src/docbkx/openstack-compute-admin/rootwrap.xml

The rootwrap.xml issue seems to be a genuine problem (reused ID). I'm not sure why it's complaining about issues with computeconfigure.xml."}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-12-18 03:19:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ah - I was running it over the wrong repo. Excellent.

I just get this error:

/home/fifieldt/temp/os-doc-0000/doc/src/docbkx/openstack-ha/ha-guide-docinfo.xml: Extra content at the end of the document, line 12, column 9


Though, we're a PEP8 compliant shop aren't we ? :)

#pep8 ../validate_new-092fb2595ae778d408b53348b2f9416daf2f98a2.py
../validate_new-092fb2595ae778d408b53348b2f9416daf2f98a2.py:97:9: E128 continuation line under-indented for visual indent
../validate_new-092fb2595ae778d408b53348b2f9416daf2f98a2.py:99:6: E128 continuation line under-indented for visual indent
../validate_new-092fb2595ae778d408b53348b2f9416daf2f98a2.py:100:9: E128 continuation line under-indented for visual indent


Let me know if you need help with those - I've had fun on another project recently making it meet PEP8 compliance :s"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-12-18 03:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-18 03:35:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/18170/4/check/gate-noop/19 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-12-18 03:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Now PEP8 compliant!

My editor (Sublime Text 2) does PEP8 checks inline, but I have the E128 check disabled.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-12-18 03:39:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The ha-guide-docinfo.xml file is, indeed, violating the docbook 5 RELAX NG schema. An easy way to check this without the script is to use the xmllint program that comes with libxml2:

$ xmllint --relaxng  http://www.docbook.org/xml/5.0/rng/docbookxi.rng --noout doc/src/docbkx/openstack-ha/ha-guide-docinfo.xml
doc/src/docbkx/openstack-ha/ha-guide-docinfo.xml:12: parser error : Extra content at the end of the document
        <copyright>
        ^'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-12-18 14:41:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I also wanted to point out https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1091684 -- we found that the link linkend cross references aren't "validating" as in there's no xml:id with the name that it refers to. I don't think this is validation against a schema but wanted to let you know I'm working on this bug as well.'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-12-19 01:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-12-21 20:28:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Finally getting around to reviewing this fine bit of work! Thanks Lorin. 

When I run it, I get this:
/Users/anne.gentle/src/openstack-manuals/doc/src/docbkx/basic-install/src/basic-install_architecture.xml:9:0:ERROR:RELAXNGV:RELAXNG_ERR_CONTENTVALID: Element imagedata failed to validate content
/Users/anne.gentle/src/openstack-manuals/doc/src/docbkx/basic-install/src/basic-install_architecture.xml:7:0:ERROR:RELAXNGV:RELAXNG_ERR_ELEMNAME: Expecting element example, got mediaobject
/Users/anne.gentle/src/openstack-manuals/doc/src/docbkx/basic-install/src/basic-install_architecture.xml:7:0:ERROR:RELAXNGV:RELAXNG_ERR_ELEMWRONG: Did not expect element mediaobject there
/Users/anne.gentle/src/openstack-manuals/doc/src/docbkx/basic-install/src/basic-install_architecture.xml:5:0:ERROR:RELAXNGV:RELAXNG_ERR_ELEMWRONG: Did not expect element section there
/Users/anne.gentle/src/openstack-manuals/doc/src/docbkx/basic-install/src/basic-install_architecture.xml:5:0:ERROR:RELAXNGV:RELAXNG_ERR_ELEMNAME: Expecting element set, got section

but in Oxygen, the file validates, I guess because Oxygen is not using RelaxNG schema? What's the difference there?"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-01-06 03:21:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Anne:

I'm not getting any warnings on that file, not sure why we are getting different output on the same repository.

Can you try to use the "xmllint" program to validate it against the RelaxNG schema:

xmllint --relaxng http://www.docbook.org/xml/5.0/rng/docbookxi.rng --noout /Users/anne.gentle/src/openstack-manuals/doc/src/docbkx/basic-install/src/basic-install_architecture.xml:'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-01-11 21:11:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Huh, xmllint command validates, so it's good to go. Are you going to integrate into CI once this lands?"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-01-15 03:49:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Anne:

I'd love to get this integrated with CI. Who's the right person to talk to, and/or which project should I look at?

Also, can somebody give this an "approved", now that there are two +2s?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-15 23:57:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2013-01-15 23:57:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-16 00:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/gate-openstack-cli-guide/gate/159/cli/quick-start : SUCCESS

commit_message:
Add script to validate files are valid DocBook.

Adds a script called tools/validate.py that will check all XML
files against the DocBook 5 RELAX NG schema.

Does not check pom.xml files or files inside of directories named
"target".

Change-Id: I9614f1b10ac2da608a245c7644309a5be38c8995

commit_message:
Remove ref to customizing api-paste.ini

Customizing api-paste.ini with keystone auth info is no longer
required. This was mostly fixed in a previous doc patch[1], but there
was a residual statement about changing api-paste.ini that's no longer
relevant.

This patch removes that statement. We no longer show the example
api-paste.ini file in the "Configuring OpenStack Compute" section,
since no changes to the file are needed.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/19582

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/15310

Change-Id: I7e7a245d6ea0e7371c0fe6c79898bd5d7fbaf89e

commit_message:
Added association support samples to network API

Modified: src/wadls/compute-api/src/ext/os-networks.wadl to link to samples in api_samples
- Disassociate only host from network
- Disassociate only project from network
- Associate network with host
Deleted:  src/wadls/compute-api/src/ext/samples/os-networks-disassociate.json (pointed to the xml/json in api_samples too).

Change-Id: Ia0960f396d6e07c0e2573594d150f40e742dd515
Fixes: bug 1077556

commit_message:
script for configuring a vif in Xen in non-bridged mode

Creates a new vif device without attaching it to a
bridge. Quantum Linux Bridge Agent will attach the
created device to the belonging bridge.

Change-Id: I1818a92a47882d98e384b57e0fa84a0fa09d40ea

commit_message:
Cells: Add cells API extension

Enables cells-related functionality such as adding neighbor cells,
listing neighbor cells, and showing the capabilities of the local cell.

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iacc1e68721a7867aeaf233903cbe6d18f09ad96e

commit_message:
Remove unused import.

Direct usage of the db has been eliminated from nova.service, so remove
the import.

Part of bp no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I909daccaf5dc0f26ad72914f90c9e2134e8decaf

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-12-19 12:36:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

picking on all quantum folks equally (you'll see it in the review queue). Please get the quantum team together and get someone to volunteer for refactoring quantum in devstack to lib/quantum, as I'm not going to +2 any more quantum changes in stack.sh."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-19 16:47:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sean: That's just...awesome.  This patch and its related quantum patches have been in process since shortly after the summit (see the 'Uploaded' date).  Regardless of how evenly the dictate to refactor devstack is being applied, I'm not sure how holding this patch hostage to that effort could be viewed as anything more than a victory of dogmatism over pragmatism."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-12-19 17:58:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

It _is_ pragmatism as stack.sh was/is a mess and moving the projects out is necessary.  I had an agreement from someone on the Quantum team with +2 on devstack to do that and it is still not done.

Regarding the length of time this patch has been in-flight, if it had been ready sooner you may have missed being caught by this particular decision.

In short, devtack is not going to support every possible combination of Quantum configurations.  We need an equivalent to nova-net's FlatDHCP.  And FWIW, this sort of paring down is also going to be considered in all other areas of devstack.  It is not all things to all people, it is an opinionated development tool."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-19 18:07:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Dean: Fair enough.  XS/XCP is not 'every possible quantum configuration' - devstack+quantum will not work on a once-important platform without this change - but who am I to argue with pragmatism."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-12-19 18:16:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Dean, Sean - I apologize for taking my frustration out on you, that's not fair."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2012-12-19 20:23:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Maru, no worries.  Part of my frustration is that I've started the Quantum refactor twice but the rate of change there was enough that the rebases were eating into other things I needed to do.

Also, Xen is a special case as we (the original gang responsible for devstack anyway) have no way to test it anymore. I generally wait for one of the xen contributors to review those patches before approving them.  All I can test is that it doesn't break a non-xen config."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-12-19 21:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This discussion actually started during the merge request to add floodlight/bigswitch plugin support for quantum.

I'm personally in favor of using a freeze on introducing new quantum plugins to devstack to "nudge" the community to refactor quantum in devstack... in fact, Sumit (author of floodlight change) had volunteered to do this work, but wanted to merge the floodlight stuff first.  I'd prefer to see the refactoring happen first.  I will ping Sumit on this.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-01-09 02:20:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-01-09 02:24:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

dan: thanks for the heads-up!

The latest patch does not touch stack.sh and adds a link to configuration instructions in the wiki.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-09 04:47:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Add limited support for Quantum+OVS on XS/XCP.

 * Add priliminary support for running the OVS L2 and DHCP agents
   in domU:
   * Configure Nova to use the correct vif driver and integration
     bridge.
   * Configure the ovs agent to target the dom0 integration bridge.
   * Install a xapi plugin supporting dom0 execution of ovs agent
     commands.
 * Config doc: http://wiki.openstack.org/QuantumDevstackOvsXcp
 * Supports blueprint xenapi-ovs

Change-Id: If5ab07daab1dc3918004eb4bfb6fed6cab0a71fd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-14 04:11:14.000000000', 'message': "Don't update count on tables without a summary row

The horizon.tabs javascript was updating the last row of any <table>
in the tab when the focus was changed to a different tab, stomping
over the last row of the table.

This commit limits updates to tables with the .datatable class,
and adds a class to the updated <span> in affected templates
so it can be selected a little more unambiguously.

Fixes bug #1080513.

Change-Id: I1b778bdc77887dcf540c96c2ab8be239bc13258c
"}]
commit_message:
Don't update count on tables without a summary row

The horizon.tabs javascript was updating the last row of any <table>
in the tab when the focus was changed to a different tab, stomping
over the last row of the table.

This commit limits updates to tables with the .datatable class,
and adds a class to the updated <span> in affected templates
so it can be selected a little more unambiguously.

Fixes bug #1080513.

Change-Id: I1b778bdc77887dcf540c96c2ab8be239bc13258c

Update latest OSLO.

commit_message:
Cells: Add some cells support to admin_actions extension

Add clearing of instance state in a way that works with cells.

Implements blueprint nova-compute-cells

Change-Id: I1cc1560bceb842c3bc82c6e9510eaef8a4931293

Implements getPasswordData for ec2

Related to blueprint get-password

commit_message:
Make resource tracker use conductor for migration updates

This method is already in conductor, so make resource tracker use it.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute

Change-Id: I193a040b3678f83148940ad28d6d0b6f44a29818

commit_message:
Adds a flag to allow configuring a region

If multiple regions contain an endpoint, extract
the correct endpoint URL from the os_region_name parameter
in nova.conf

Fixes LP Bug #1087735

Change-Id: Id4e4f56f336cd2b092a173b3c8e695b173c76f2a
